$("#filter_country_hotels select").change(function(){form_submit();});hiq_sort();})
function form_submit(){var ajaxContainer=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('ajaxContainer');var pageUrl=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('pageUrl');var formId=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('formId');var callback=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('callback');var scroll_to='';var page=1;paginate_ajax(page,ajaxContainer,pageUrl,formId,callback,scroll_to);}

$("#filter_country_hotels select").change(function(){form_submit();});hiq_sort();})
function form_submit(){var ajaxContainer=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('ajaxContainer');var pageUrl=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('pageUrl');var formId=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('formId');var callback=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('callback');var scroll_to='';var page=1;paginate_ajax(page,ajaxContainer,pageUrl,formId,callback,scroll_to);}

function form_submit(){var ajaxContainer=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('ajaxContainer');var pageUrl=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('pageUrl');var formId=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('formId');var callback=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('callback');var scroll_to='';var page=1;paginate_ajax(page,ajaxContainer,pageUrl,formId,callback,scroll_to);}

function form_submit(){var ajaxContainer=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('ajaxContainer');var pageUrl=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('pageUrl');var formId=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('formId');var callback=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('callback');var scroll_to='';var page=1;paginate_ajax(page,ajaxContainer,pageUrl,formId,callback,scroll_to);}

HolidayIQ.com is a premier holiday information portal powered by India's first & biggest travel community; enabling travellers to first discover numerous vacation choices, then plan holiday trips in full detail and finally, share holiday experiences with millions of other travellers.

function form_submit(){var ajaxContainer=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('ajaxContainer');var pageUrl=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('pageUrl');var formId=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('formId');var callback=$("#filter_country_hotels").next().find(".data-paginate").data('callback');var scroll_to='';var page=1;paginate_ajax(page,ajaxContainer,pageUrl,formId,callback,scroll_to);}

Useful Links for Bihar

Articles and Blogs

Bihar Information  - Welcome to to Bihar. Bihar or ancient Magadha, has been the cradle of Indian civilization and the centre of Indian culture and education. 
Bihar Blog  - Blog about Bihar Today, news & views about Bihar, regular updates on Bihar, Articles about Bihar etc.,

Official Websites

Bihar Tourism  - Bihar Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Bihar Culture, Places of Interest and Tourism in Bihar.
Bihar official sites Directory  - Bihar Government Web directory of Health, Bihar Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.

Other Useful Links

Jai Bihar  - Jai Bihar: The Land Where Gods Chose to Take Birth. The History of Bihar as a region is very rich and eventful. This is due to the fact that Bihar was a center of power, learning and culture.
Buddhist Circuit  - BodhGaya is 15 kms. from Gaya. About 2500 years ago, Gautam the prince of Kapilvastu attained enlightenment under the Peepal tree to become Buddha.

Useful Links for Haryana

Articles and Blogs

Haryana Information  - Haryana is the region where, along the banks of the River Saraswati, the Vedic Civilization began and matured. It was here that the Vedas were written, as the Aryans chanted their sacred Mantras. 
Rural India draws in tourists  - If you want a holiday in India but are not attracted by the Taj Mahal or the beaches of Goa, you could always go and milk a cow. 

Official Websites

Government of Haryana  - Haryana Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Haryana Tourism  - Haryana Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Haryana, Festivals in Haryana and Culture in Haryana.

Other Useful Links

Haryana Travel Guide  - Travel guide about Haryana: People, Culture, Traditions, Music, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,
Surajkund Mela  - Craftsmen from all over India assemble here during the first fortnight of February for an annual fair known as Surajkund Crafts Mela.

Articles and Blogs

Official Websites

Himachal Pradesh Government  - Himachal Pradesh Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Himachal Tourism  - Himachal Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Himachal Entry formalities, Places of Interest in Himachal and Culture in Himachal Pradesh.

Other Useful Links

Mountaineering and Allied Sports  - The Directorate of Mountaineering and Allied Sports is located in Manali, Himachal Pradesh & provides specialised training in Mountaineering, Mountain Rescue, Skiing, Water Sports, Trekking and Rock Climbing. 
Kasauli  - Kasauli is situated at an elevation of over 6,000 feet. The hill station boasts of a picture of tranquility amidst the aroma and chill of chirpines, firs, rhododendrons, oaks and willows.

Useful Links for Jammu & Kashmir

Articles and Blogs

Holy Amarnath: A pilgrimage to paradise  - Amarnath is an ancient pilgrimage centre. The Amarnath cave is located at a distance of 86 miles north east of Srinagar, at a height of 13000 feet above sea level. 
Kashmir Blog  - Kashmir includes the regions of Kashmir valley, Jammu and Ladakh. The Valley is a low-lying fertile region surrounded by magnificent mountains and fed by many rivers. 

Official Websites

Jammu & Kashmir Tourism  - Jammu & Kashmir Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Jammu & Kashmir Entry formalities, Places of Interest in Jammu & Kashmir, Lists of Tourist Guides in Jammu & Kashmir and Transportation in Jammu & Kashmir.
Jammu & Kashmir Government  - Jammu & Kashmir Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

A brief history of Kashmir  - The earliest history of Kashmir was recorded by the poet-chronicler Kalhana in the 12th century.
Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine  - The journey to the Holy Shrine of Mata Vaishno Devi is an enchanting journey of the places where Mata Vaishnavi had spent some time while observing various spiritual disciplines and penances.

Useful Links for Madhya Pradesh

Articles and Blogs

Madhya Pradesh Information  - Madhya Pradesh has rich heritage and culture. This website showcases Land, History, People, Festivals, Economy, Arts, Crafts etc.,

Heart of India Blog  - Madhya Pradesh lies in central part of India and is perhaps the oldest part of the subcontinent - called the Gondwana - the home of the Gonds. This Blog tries to bring out the hidden magic in this very heart of India.

Official Websites

Government of Madhya Pradesh  - Madhya Pradesh Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Madhya Pradesh Tourism  - Madhya Pradesh Tourism Government portal -Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Madhya Pradesh, Ancient Temples in Madhya Pradesh and Festivals in Madhya Pradesh.

Other Useful Links

Narmada River  - The construction of large dams on the River Narmada and its impact on millions of people living in the river valley has become one of the most important social issues in contemporary India.
Temples of Madhya Pradesh  - Madhya Pradesh abounds in natural wealth. The Khajuraho temples attract tourists from all over the world. Madhya Pradesh is also home to two ancient pilgrimage sites Ujjain and Omkareshwar.

Useful Links for Punjab

Articles and Blogs

The Golden Temple(Harmandir Sahib)  - The Golden temple of Amritsar, known as swarn mandir or swarna mandir, located in Punjab, is the famous pilgrimage place for sikhs in India.
Imagining Punjab in the Age of Globalization  - Though Punjab was reorganised as a separate state of independent India on the basis of language, it is often seen as a land of the Sikhs, despite the fact that Hindus and Muslims were in larger numbers in the region.


Official Websites

Government of Punjab  - Punjab Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Directory of sites  - Punjab Government Web directory of Health, Punjab Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.

Useful Links for Uttar Pradesh

Articles and Blogs

Know Uttar Pradesh  - The history of the State of Uttar Pradesh is very ancient and interesting. It is recognised in the later Vedic Age as Brahmarshi Desha or Madhya Desha.
Sarnath, Uttar Pradesh  - Travel Blog about Sarnath & its Buddhist monasteries, Culture, Traditions, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,

Official Websites

Government of Uttar Pradesh  - Uttar Pradesh Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Uttar Pradesh Tourism  - Uttar Pradesh Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Uttar Pradesh, Lists of Hotels in Uttar Pradesh and Historic places in Uttar Pradesh.

Other Useful Links

Uttar Pradesh at a Glance  - In this Web site, you will find information on all aspects of Uttar Pradesh: History of Uttar Pradesh, Geography of Uttar Pradesh, Economy of Uttar Pradesh etc.,
World Heritage Sites - Agra - Taj Mahal  - Taj Mahal was built by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his queen, Mumtaz Mahal. The Taj Mahal is the mausoleum of both Mumtaz Mahal and Shah Jahan.

Useful Links for Uttaranchal

Articles and Blogs

Uttara Portal  - In this Citizen Portal you will find information on all aspects of Uttaranchal affecting peoples life in Uttaranchal.
My Trip To Uttaranchal  - Blog about trip to Uttaranchal: Wild Life, White Water Rafting, Photographs etc.,

Official Websites

Uttarakhand Government  - Uttarakhand Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Uttarakhand Tourism  - Uttarakhand Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Uttarakhand, Historic places in Uttarakhand etc.,

Other Useful Links

Char- Dham Yatra  - Char Dham is a term coined for the four most revered Hindu temples viz. Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath and Badrinath. According to the Puranas and various Hindu scriptures the Char Dham Yatra is of very high religious significance.
Garhwal Mandal Vikas Nigam  - Website of Garhwal Mandal Vikas Nigam Ltd., provider of tourism services in the Garhwal region of Uttarakhand.

Useful Links for Rajasthan

Articles and Blogs

Explore Rajasthan  - Rajasthan is considered to be the land of monuments because the desert land of Rajasthan is dotted with many timeless and spectacular forts & palaces. 
Travel Essay: Dreaming of Rajasthan  - Travel Essay on a trip to Rajasthan: Driving directions, Road condition, Amber Palace, Hawa Mahal, Culture etc.,

Official Websites

Rajasthan Tourism  - Rajasthan Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Rajasthan, Forts in Rajasthan and Transportation in Rajasthan.
Government of Rajasthan  - Rajasthan Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Pushkar Camel Fair  - Pushkar Camel Fair is a Livestock fair in India. The Pushkar fair features thousands of people, camels and horses. Buyers and sellers come to negotiate deals over their prized animals. 
Palace on Wheels Train  - The possibility of traveling in royal splendor of a bygone era has become a reality with the introduction of Palace on Wheels.

Useful Links for Jammu & Kashmir

Articles and Blogs

Holy Amarnath: A pilgrimage to paradise  - Amarnath is an ancient pilgrimage centre. The Amarnath cave is located at a distance of 86 miles north east of Srinagar, at a height of 13000 feet above sea level. 
Kashmir Blog  - Kashmir includes the regions of Kashmir valley, Jammu and Ladakh. The Valley is a low-lying fertile region surrounded by magnificent mountains and fed by many rivers. 

Official Websites

Jammu & Kashmir Tourism  - Jammu & Kashmir Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Jammu & Kashmir Entry formalities, Places of Interest in Jammu & Kashmir, Lists of Tourist Guides in Jammu & Kashmir and Transportation in Jammu & Kashmir.
Jammu & Kashmir Government  - Jammu & Kashmir Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

A brief history of Kashmir  - The earliest history of Kashmir was recorded by the poet-chronicler Kalhana in the 12th century.
Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine  - The journey to the Holy Shrine of Mata Vaishno Devi is an enchanting journey of the places where Mata Vaishnavi had spent some time while observing various spiritual disciplines and penances.

Articles and Blogs

Useful Links for Orissa

Articles and Blogs

Orissa Portal  - Welcome to Orissa - In this Web site, you will find information on all aspects of Orissa. Discussions on varied issues that Orissa faces etc., 
Orissa Blog  - Your informal resource to Orissa. Blog on Orissa, People, Culture, Traditions, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,

Official Websites

Orissa Tourism  - Orissa Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Orissa, List of Temples in Orissa and Transportation in Orissa.
Government of Orissa  - Orissa Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Forts of Orissa  - Orissa is a land of rich cultural beauty and heritage. The fort of Barabati, was the last greatest citadel of the monarchs of Orissa. 
History of Orissa  - The origin and early history of the land, known as Kalinga in ancient times, is lost in dim past, though it is mentioned in ancient Indian epics and other texts.

Useful Links for West Bengal

Articles and Blogs

West Bengal Economy  - West Bengal is the third largest economy in India. The states key areas of strength include petrochemicals, steel, food processing and leather. 
Birbhum, West Bengal  - The folk culture of Birbhum is specially enriched with the contribution of Bauls, their philosophy and their songs.

Official Websites

Government of West Bengal  - West Bengal Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
West Bengal Tourism  - West Bengal Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Beaches in West Bengal, Places of Interest in West Bengal, Lists of Hotels in West Bengal and Historic places in West Bengal.

Other Useful Links

Kolkata An Enigma  - Kolkata, the capital of West Bengal is a seething mass of activity with a cosmopolitan atmosphere. Kolkata has become a centre of cultural as well as political and economic life of Bengal.
Farmland to factory in industrializing India  - Just beyond the city limits of Kolkata, a patch of land where an auto factory is planned amid a sprawl of potato fields and rice paddies has become a battleground for the government.

Useful Links for Goa

Articles and Blogs

Goa Travel Article  - Come to Goa. Change your mind. Change your way. Goa is about Beaches, parties, Sea food and what not.
Goa Blog  - Goa India beaches are amongst worlds best tourism destinations to enjoy your holidays. Goa Blog brings to you updates on Goa News, Photos, Parties, Hotels and Resorts, Goas Art and Culture and Politics.

Official Websites

Goa Government  - Goa Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Goa Tourism  - Goa Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Beaches in Goa, Places of Interest in Goa, Lists of Hotels in Goa and Historic places in Goa.

Other Useful Links

Weather  - Weather forecast for Goa with a fast, easy to use interface. Includes weather maps, graphics and radar images.
Latest from Goa  - Know whats happening in Goa. Latest stories, news, blog, events in goa, Beaches in Goa, Churches in Goa etc.,

Useful Links for Gujarat

Articles and Blogs

Gujarat Tourist Spots  - Gujarat is a state full of history, heritage and culture. The jungles are verdant, lush and green, where lions prowl and flamingoes preen. 
Birds of Gujarat Blog  - Gujarat is one of Indias most prolific birding areas. It has a variety of habitats including the saline desert wilderness of the Great and Little Rann of Kutch, the arid grasslands and scrub of Banni in Kutch and the Kathiawad Peninsula.

Official Websites

Gujarat Government  - Gujarat Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Gujarat Tourism  - Gujarat Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism covers Places of Interest in Gujarat, Lists of Historical places in Gujarat and Festivals in Gujarat.

Other Useful Links

Directory of official sites  - Gujarat Government Web directory of Health, Gujarat Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.
Dandiya Zone  - Welcome to Dandiya Zone, a site dedicated to the most popular Indian dance festival - Navratri. Find out everything about the Navratri festival.

Useful Links for Maharashtra

Articles and Blogs

Welcome to Maharashtra  - Maharashtra is very popular among tourists of India. In fact, its capital city is one of the most visited cities in the entire country of India. 
Maharashtra Tourism Blog  - Lush green hilly plains, calm clean and scenic sea shores, historical monuments, Wild life and reserve forests, these are the few words that can replace the word "Maharashtra Tourism" .

Official Websites

Maharashtra Tourism  - Maharashtra Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Maharashtra, Lists of Temples in Maharashtra etc.,
Maharashtra Government  - Maharashtra Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Deccan Odyssey  - A heritage train tour on the Deccan Odyssey through the kingdom of the Marathas - Maharashtra. Travel through time and cultures.
Maharashtra woos medical tourists  - Medical Tourism: Many people from the developed world are coming to Maharashtra for hip replacements or brain surgery.

Useful Links for Maharashtra

Articles and Blogs

Welcome to Maharashtra  - Maharashtra is very popular among tourists of India. In fact, its capital city is one of the most visited cities in the entire country of India. 
Maharashtra Tourism Blog  - Lush green hilly plains, calm clean and scenic sea shores, historical monuments, Wild life and reserve forests, these are the few words that can replace the word "Maharashtra Tourism" .

Official Websites

Maharashtra Tourism  - Maharashtra Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Maharashtra, Lists of Temples in Maharashtra etc.,
Maharashtra Government  - Maharashtra Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Deccan Odyssey  - A heritage train tour on the Deccan Odyssey through the kingdom of the Marathas - Maharashtra. Travel through time and cultures.
Maharashtra woos medical tourists  - Medical Tourism: Many people from the developed world are coming to Maharashtra for hip replacements or brain surgery.

Useful Links for Andaman & Nicobar

Articles and Blogs

History of Andaman Islands  - In this site you will find about Andamanese and other Negrito people and the Out-of-Africa Story of the human race.
Andaman Blog  - Blog about Andamans. Andamans is a archipelago of over 570 Islands spread over an area of about 700 KM and is covered with lush green forests, velvet blue sea, coral gardens.

Official Websites

Andaman & Nicobar Tourism  - Andaman & Nicobar Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Entry formalities, Places of Interest, Lists of Tourist Guides and Transportation in Andaman.
Andaman & Nicobar Administration  - Andaman & Nicobar Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Andaman District  - Government website of district of Andamans, covers health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Nicobar District  - Government website of district of Nicobar, covers health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Useful Links for Andhra Pradesh

Articles and Blogs

Andhra Pradesh  - Andhra Pradesh Tourism: Andhra Pradesh is rich in historical monuments. It has many holy temples with architectural beauty, which attract large numbers of pilgrims and tourists.

Andhra Pradesh Blog  - Andhra Pradesh is considered the rice bowl of India. The state is crossed by two major rivers, the Godavari and Krishna. 

Official Websites

Andhra Pradesh Tourism  - Andhra Pradesh Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Andhra Pradesh Tourism, Places of Interest in Andhra Pradesh and Festivals in Andhra Pradesh.
Government of Andhra Pradesh  - Andhra Pradesh Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Arts & Crafts  - Arts and Crafts in Andhra Pradesh: Banjara Embroidery, Bronze Castings, Stone Carvings, Wood Carvings,
Folk Paintings, Puppets, Toys and Dolls. 
Directory of official sites of Andhra Pradesh  - Andhra Pradesh Government Web directory of Health, Andhra Pradesh Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.

Useful Links for Karnataka

Articles and Blogs

Indias Silicon Valley  - Karnataka has emerged as the computer capital and centre of high-tech industries, especially software. Bangalore has for long been known as Indias answer to Silicon Valley.
The Great Birding Party-Dandeli, Karnataka  - Visit Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary, a place where you can see Birds that you always dreamt to see.


Official Websites

Government of Karnataka  - Karnataka Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Karnataka Tourism  - Karnataka Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Karnataka, List of Ancient Temples in Karnataka and Festivals in Karnataka.

Karnataka trip  - Blog about Karnataka - Karnataka Blog on Travel, People, Culture, Links, News, Articles, Places etc.,
Hindu temples  - Pictures about Hindu Temples in Karnataka: Achyutaraya temple in Vijayanagar, Nandi Hill,
Kudroli Sri Gokarnatheshwara temple, Vitthala temple etc.,

Useful Links for Kerala

Articles and Blogs

National Geographic Traveler  - Kerala, also known as Gods Own Country is a place to simply sit back and enjoy. The name means "land of coconuts," and the palms shade nearly the entire state from the tropical sun.
Kerala Blog  - Blog about Kerala - Kerala Blog on People, Culture, Traditions, Music, Video, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,

Official Websites

Kerala Tourism  - Kerala Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Places of Interest in Kerala, Culture in Kerala etc.,
Kerala Government  - Kerala Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Kerala Photographs  - Stock Photography of Kerala: Find thousands of Photographs about People, Culture, Traditions, Music, Tourism, Places, Beaches etc.,
Bekal Resorts  - Bekal Resorts is being developed as as an international standard Beach Tourist Destination. The Government is ensuring that Bekal retains its natural vegetation and pristine charm.

Useful Links for Lakshadweep

Articles and Blogs

Lakshadweep Information  - Lakshadweep is the only coral Island in India that has a rich flora & fauna. There is complete silence here except for the cry of a seabird or the sound of waves.
Lakshadweep: The Epilogue  - Blog about Lakshadweep- Lakshadweep Blog on Beaches, People, Culture, Traditions, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,

Official Websites

Lakshadweep Administration  - Lakshadweep Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Tourism in Lakshadweep  - Lakshadweep Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Lakshadweep Entry formalities, Places of Interest in Lakshadweep, List of Beaches in Lakshadweep and Transportation in Lakshadweep.

Other Useful Links

Society for Promotion of Nature Tourism and Sports  - The main aim of the organisation is to promote eco-friendly tourism and recreational activities in the islands in collaboration with the Lakshadweep Administration.
Minicoy Weather  - Weather forecast for Minicoy with a fast, easy to use interface. Includes weather maps, graphics and radar images.

Official Websites

Tamil Nadu Tourism  - Tamil Nadu Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Beaches in Tamil Nadu, Places of Interest in Tamil Nadu and Historic places in Tamil Nadu.

Other Useful Links

Useful Links for Assam

Articles and Blogs

Assam Portal  - Welcome to Assam - In this Web site, you will find information on all aspects of Assam. Discussions on varied issues that Assam faces in the form of bulletin boards, forums and mailing lists.
Assam Blog  - Blog about Assam - Assam Blog on Assam, Assamese People, Culture, Traditions, Music, Video, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.

Official Websites

Government of Assam  - Assam Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Directory of official sites of Assam  - Assam Government Web directory of Health, Assam Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.

Other Useful Links

Assam Tourism  - Assam Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Assam Entry formalities, Places of Interest in Assam, Lists of Tourist Guides in Assam and Transportation in Assam.
Rongali Bihu in Assam  - Bihu Harvest festival of Assam - Assam celebrates major agricultural events as the festival of Bihu. There are three Bihu festivals in Assam - Rongali Bihu, Magh Bihu and Kati Bihu.

Useful Links for Manipur

Articles and Blogs

Article: Manipur Tourism  - Nestling deep within a lush green corner of northeast India is a beautiful little Shangrila called Manipur. This little corner is a veritable paradise on earth.
The Wonder that is wandering Manipur  - Blog about Manipur - Manipur Blog on People, Culture, Traditions, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,

Official Websites

Manipur Government  - Manipur Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Directory of Manipur sites  - Manipur Government Web directory of Health, Manipur Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.

Other Useful Links

Manipur History, Nature, Culture & more  - Nestled on a plateau and surrounded by nine sub-Himalayan ranges of hills, Manipur is the place that gifted the game of Polo to the world. 
Manipur: Jewel of the East or Wild East ?  - Manipur, with its salubrious climate, its green fields, its misty hills and its pollution-free sky, is among the most beautiful and scenic places in India.

Useful Links for Meghalaya

Articles and Blogs

Meghalaya  - Meghalaya is a source of inspiration to any poet, a dramatic canvas for an artists dream, and the ideal retreat for people in search of beauty and solitude. 
Living Root Bridges of Meghalaya  - The Khasi ancestors who had conceived the idea, patiently persevered with their experiments stretched over long years and had perfected the art of making these "Living Root Bridges" for generations to use and benefit from their superb bio-engineering creations.


Official Websites

Government of Meghalaya  - Meghalaya Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Meghalaya Tourism  - Meghalaya Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Meghalaya Entry formalities, Places of Interest in Meghalaya, Lists of Tourist Guides in Meghalaya and Transportation in Meghalaya.

Other Useful Links

Worlds wettest area dries up  - The Khasi Hills, in a remote part of north-east India, usually experience torrential rains. One of the worlds wettest places, Cherrapunji is suffering from a shortage of water.

The Caves Of Meghalaya  - Meghalaya borders Bangladesh in the south and Assam in the north. Meghalaya is reputed to be the wettest place on earth and also a land of caves, with more than 500.

Useful Links for Mizoram

Articles and Blogs

Mesmerising Mizoram  - Mizoram is considered Switzerland of India for its beauty. Mizoram is situated in the middle of lot of very beautiful mountains on a good height, away from land.
Sound of Music  - Blog about Mizoram - People, Culture, Traditions, Music, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,

Official Websites

Mizoram Tourism  - Mizoram Tourism Government portal - Official website of Dept. of Tourism, covers Mizoram Entry formalities, Places of Interest in Mizoram and Transportation in Mizoram.
Mizoram Government  - Mizoram Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Mizoram Information  - Blog about Mizoram and its culture, tourism, education, history, art, sports, religion, dance, cooking etc.,
Profile - Mizoram  - Mizoram means, Land of the Highlanders in the local language, Mizo. The Mizo Hills, which dominate the states topography, rise to more than 2000 m near the Myanmar border.

Useful Links for Nagaland

Articles and Blogs

Tourism- Nagaland  - Nagaland is famous for its rich mosaic of numerous tribes with their rich culture. Agriculture and animal husbandry, including poultry, are the main occupations of the Nagas. 
Nagaland Blog  - Information about Nagaland and its culture, tourism, education,history, art, sports, religion, dance, cooking etc.,

Official Websites

Government of Nagaland  - Nagaland Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Directory of Nagaland sites  - Nagaland Government Web directory of Health, Nagaland Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.

Other Useful Links

Destination Nagaland, the new eco-tourism destination  - Nagaland, the picturesque north eastern state is abundant in natural beauty, wildlife and exquisite in flora and fauna.
Arts & Crafts  - Nagaland: The Land, People, Social and Cultural Heritage, Economy, Festivals, Places of Interest, Fact file, Bamboo and Cane of Nagaland, Pottery Making in Nagaland etc.,

Useful Links for Sikkim

Articles and Blogs

Sikkim Portal  - Everything about Sikkim, Tourism, Trekking, Maps, Guide, Hotels etc., With its pristine and un-spoilt natural beauty and peace loving people, Sikkim offers you a truly unique visitor experience.
Sikkim Tourism Promotes Its Monasteries  - Sikkim has number of Monasteries which include Rumtek Dharma Chakra Center and old Rumtek monastery,Dodrul Chorten and Enchey Monastery in Gangtok etc.,

Official Websites

Government of Sikkim  - Sikkim Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.
Sikkim Directory  - Sikkim Government Web directory of Health, Sikkim Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.

Other Useful Links

Flora & Fauna  - Sikkim stretches from the low lands in the south to the mountainous regions in the north. The altitude varies right from sea level to mountain peaks covering a wide spectrum of flora and fauna. 
Sikkim Guide  - Know about Sikkim & its People, Culture, Traditions, Links, News, Articles, Tourism, Places etc.,

Useful Links for Tripura

Articles and Blogs

Places of Interest  - Tripura has beautiful rock cut carvings and stone images at Unakoti, Devtamura and Pilak. During November every year, the unique Orange & Tourism festival is celebrated in the Jampui hills.
Tripura History  - The history of Tripura is very old. It dates back to the era of the Mahabharata. The name of the Tripura was mentioned in the the above epic along with the states like Manipur, Kamrup (Assam) etc.,

Official Websites

Directory of Sites of Tripura  - Tripura Government Web directory of Health, Tripura Tourism, Education, Finance, Banking, Judiciary and Executive.
Government of Tripura  - Tripura Government portal covering diverse topics including health, tourism, culture, climate, Tenders and e-Governance.

Other Useful Links

Agartala Weather  - Weather forecast for Agartala with a fast, easy to use interface. Includes weather maps, graphics and radar images.
West Tripura District Administration  - The West Tripura District is bounded by Bangladesh in the north and west by North Tripura in the east and by South Tripura in the south. The district headquarters is located at Agartala.

Travelling Tips to Rajgir



Awesome
Post by Partha | Kolkata | Feb 1, 2012
From Bakhtiyarpur junction one can get buses, taxis, trains. Train's frequency is not good. Bus can take to Biharsarif & from there change of bus may be needed. upto 5pm conveyance is available.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Kurukshetra



Post by Neeraj | Gwalior | Jan 11, 2013
You can pick a Volvo from ISBT delhi and it takes 3.5 hrs to reach on a very nice road. You can take trains like shane - punjab etc to reach there.
This place is good for blankets so you can buy nice quality blanket in very low cost.

Read full review

Travelling Tips to Chail



An escape to nature
Post by Kunal | Chandigarh | Apr 5, 2011
Bus from Shimla, Chandigarh, Solan... but i would sugget train from Kalka to Shimla then taxi upto Chail... from Chandigarh, adventure lovers can go bike too!
Read full review 





GODS OWN PLACE
Post by Niraj | Taliwang | Dec 11, 2012
A good single road to Chail..Its a steep climb and the vehicle need to have good clutch plates otherwise a wonderful drive. Road is bit narrow so no high speeding required and when you occassionaly see a vehicle coming from the opposite direction its better for either of the vehicle to stop and let the other pass by. When raining its better to look for some small villages on the way to stop and wait for the rain to stop as the road becomes bit slippery and no need to take chance.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Chamba



Chamba
Post by Invincible | Amritsar | May 13, 2009
From Amritsar ......you can take train but it departs late at night.....around 1:30 AM. Buses are always there outside of railway station generally departs around after 10 pm.
Read full review 





Ashiana
Post by Pawan soni
Chamba is near to Khajiyar (Dalhosie) khajiyar is famous as mini swiss. And chamba is also famous for minjar fair & other temple like Laxminaryan & Museum etc. 
Read full review 





memorable visit to chamba. 
Post by Suhas
People should travel by taxi, or by own vehicle. so that they can see the beauty of chamba, also people should carry some warm clothes as the climate is sometimes too cold there.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Dalhousie



Perfect Summer Break
Post by Sandeep | Gurgaon | Jun 26, 2012
Love driving and stay in and around Delhi , drive your own car
Reach by rail to chakki bank and then hire a taxi to dalhousie in 1500 rs.and vice versa.
If want to travel by bus, reach Pathankot and hire a Volvo or taxi (advance booking on male trip or redbuds.in)
Read full review 





Magical Place
Post by Poonam | Mumbai | Jun 19, 2012
One can reach Dalhousie via Pathankot, Amritsar or Dharamshala via tourist vehicle. Do not travel during month of feb - march. Due to heavy snow fall one may stuck downway to Dalhousie i.e. near bus stop,
Read full review 





A tranquil getaway
Post by SML | Bangalore | Apr 27, 2010
The best (and only) way to reach Dalhousie is by road. We took a cab from Pathankot ( after an overnight 10-hr journey by train from Delhi). Took us about 2.5 hrs to reach D'housie through the twists and turns. It would be a good idea to contact your hotel and see if they could arrange for a cab (just to ensure reliability of the driver).
One caution: Get some motion-sickness medicines from your doc before this trip since the slopes and bends are sure to make you throw up more than once.
Read full review 





Dalhousie - A serene break from daily chaos
Post by hym | Delhi | Apr 27, 2010
Train:
You can reach Dalhousie via Pathankot. If you are going from Delhi, there are two trains for Pathankot: Jammu Mail (daily, but hard to find a reservation) and Dhauladhar Exp (alternate days, I got a confirmed reservation when Jammu mail had 35+ waiting). They both drop you at Pathankot in the morning.
Form Pathankot, you can take a bus or a taxi. Taxi usually charges Rs 1500.
Tip: If you have motion sickness, do not eat anything in 3-4 hrs before you leave.
Again, if you are from Delhi, contact Imazine Holidays (www.imazineholidays.co.in) at Dwarka, sec 10. They gave a me a very nice package which included sightseeing, hotel accommodation, and pick/up drop, much less than the other tour operators.
Read full review 





Dalhousie Travelogue
Post by Hesitant Traveller | Delhi | Sep 30, 2009
Reaching there: Reach Pathankot and hire a taxi (Rs. 1300) as the buses are shabby and their journey tiresome.
Book a hotel on either end of the Mall road.
Ba ready to shell out money on taxi (inside and outside Dalhousie).
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Dharamshala





Spiritual and adventure tourism
Post by Nitin
Reaching Dharamsala
1 By air: Fly to gaggal airport and than take a half an huyr drive in Cab to Mcleodganj
2.By train:To Chakki bank railways station,and than two and a half hour drive.
Travel warning:
No use of plastics allowed.
No smoking zone.
PreWeather conditions should be taken.

Read full review 







The Foodies' paradise in the hills !
Post by Vikas | Delhi | Jul 4, 2006
A few steps further is the German restaurant: sounds like fancy place but has palm leaf (dried) roof with pebble stones as floor: enjoy the Pizza, Pasta and the Salads. Folks seem to be enjoying the Indian food here too !
Finally dinner at Pema Thang brought us close to authentic Tibetian food. Also some of the novel Pizzas (pineapple included) !
Foodies enjoy..the fun of discovering these new places !
Read full review 





A unique place to view sun-set (naddi)
Post by Ashok | Delhi | May 3, 2012
Reach m'clodganj via dharamshala. naddi is around 6 kms away from m'clodganj. you can reach by your own conveyance or taxi or local buses also.
to get a good place to stay at reasonable rates try to reach before 3 p.m. after which time customer's bargaining power reduces to half reason being, availability of vacant rooms reduces resulting into higher room charges. himgiri resorts is one of the best places to stay there.

Read full review 





McLeodganj & Beyond
Post by Pravinkumar | Mumbai | May 1, 2006
A trek from McLeodganj is the best way to discover Bhagsunaag, I was there during the rains in August & a good rain protection is a must if you want to Take full benefit of the rain trek.
Read full review 







Bustling
Post by TheJunkie | Mumbai | Aug 31, 2011
Avoid traveling in monsoon as it is pouring and all sights are invisible. In other seasons you can take the flight from Delhi if you want to cut down travel time. In case you are flying into Delhi, please take a connecting flight of Kingfisher ONLY as they will adjust you in case of delays/cancellations.
By road it is accessible from Most of Northern Punjab, like Pathankot. A direct cab from Delhi will take around 7 hours in good conditions and about 12 hours by bus.

Travelling Tips to Kasauli



KASAULI- The Dream Hill Town
Post by Varun
WARNING- Kasauli is purely an Army Cantonment. Any unruly behaviour such as littering, drinking in public, destruction of public property or rowdy behaviour may land you into trouble with the Army and Locals.
REACHING THERE- Nearest station is Kalka, from there buses are avaliable to Dharampur-near Kasauli, The Heritage toy Train is also avaliable till Dharampur.
Taxis are very expensive.
Patients suffering from medical problems must carry their medications as medical facilities in Kasauli is limited.
Read full review 





Kasauli -a relaxing getaway
Post by Vishal | Mumbai | Jun 15, 2006
It is 55 kms from Chandigarh and can be reached by bus/ car. Kasauli has a small market catering to items of daily needs, other than that there is nothing to write home about. There is only one chemist shop so if you are on any special medication be sure to carry it along as you may not get it in kasauli.
Read full review 





Kasauli - The sleepy Hill Station
Post by HimanshuG | Delhi | Jun 1, 2006
Just off the Kalka-Shimla highway, Kasauli is connected to Shimla, chandigarh and Kalka by regular, local buses. Travelling by rail between Shimla and Kalka, get off at Dharampuri and then take a 12km. bus ride.
Good food can be had at Giani's dhaba at dharampuri. Weather is pleasant throughout year and winters are deceptively cold.
Read full review 





Himachal Paradise
Post by Preeti  | Mumbai | Feb 23, 2012
We took the Kalka Mail express train from Delhi to Kalka station. The station is approx 40 km from the hill station so prepared to have a private car pickup. Kalka is a bustling town in itself but the climb is steep and getting around to a bus stand or a taxi would seem a tedious task. The closest airport is Chandigarh which is approx 60 Km from Kasauli. 
Read full review 





kasauli tourism
Post by Denis | Chandigarh | Nov 2, 2010
By Air : Nearest airport is at Chandigarh (65 km) and Shimla (73 km) from Kasauli. Major domestic airlines fly between Delhi and Chandigarh. Tourist can take taxi or bus to reach Kasauli.
By Rail : Prain route is the best way to reach Kasauli as it passes through lush green forests and mountain ranges. The nearest railhead is at Kalka, 37 km away, from where one can take taxi, which takes an hour to reach Kasauli.
By Road : Kasauli is 315 Kms away from Delhi and tourist can cover this distance with the help of state transport buses or private taxis. These transports are easily available for Kasauli from Delhi, Chandigarh, Kalka and Shimla.
By Internal Transport : Travelling inside the city is convenient and comfortable. There are taxis, autos and buses, which are readily available from all the major intersections of the city.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Kufri



Kufri
Post by Jitin | Faridabad | Dec 17, 2012
it is better to travel by own car but if required the hotel also arranges for taxi.You can also catch the train from Kalka station till shimla and from there You can easily take a taxi to Gallu Resort
Read full review 





A nice place with cheats around
Post by Rahul | Gurgaon | Aug 31, 2010
While going from Shimla you will find several youths who will represent themselves as local guide. Don't believe them as they are the agents of the donkeywalas at Kufri and will accompny only till base point. They will introduce you to any donkeywalas and take commission from them. Don't hire any donkey. They are just waste of money. Donkeywalas are cheat and sometimes they are even dangerous (I had to cal local police when I visited Kufri last time. Local police is quite helpful). Just walk up the hill, its more entertaining than riding dolkey.
Read full review 







Calm and silent place
Post by Don
Please be careful while driving. some streches are steap. the drive to hatu peak is highky dangerous and adventurous. Also there are snowy seasons when it becomes difficult to drive. During 1st week of august you can enjoy apples which would be ripe by then
Read full review 





Hotel at Kufri; what to take care of:
Post by Amit | Delhi | Oct 30, 2012
If you want to go at minimum cost:
1. From Kalka take Toy Train if you have the time otherwise catch a state bus for shimla and reach shimla within 3 hours.
2. Then take a hotel at shimla or reach kufri via Bus or Car and book the hotel holiday inn.
3. After reaching hotel, fresh yourself and enjoy Kufri environment through Horse riding, trekking, etc.
4. AT returning book a car and visit mall road, Jakku Mandir, etc.
5. Plan for at least 2 nights and 2 days to enjoy.

Read full review

Travelling Tips to Kullu



Kullu Dushera
Post by M k | Delhi | Feb 11, 2013
One can take flight to Kullu. The Himachal Pardesh Roadways Volvo Buses or AC buses are not good, hence not recommended. However, Himachal Pardesh Tourism Volvo Buses are good and recommended.
Read full review 





Milky view of Himalayas
Post by Shiv kumar
Before booking Air Tkts, checked weather condition. Flight cancellation is common due to bad weather. On rainy season, we should be careful on driving due land sliding.
Read full review 







Valley of Gods 
Post by Panki Sood
Kullu By Air:
Nearest airport to Kullu is Bhuntar airport, which is at a distance of 10 km from the city center of Kullu but has low connectivity. Paid taxi service from airport to Kullu costs about Rs 250.
Kullu By Train:
Jogindernagar is the nearest railhead to Kullu, which is at a distance of 125 km. This railway station is connected to all Indian cities via Chandigarh which is 270 km away from Kullu.
Read full review 





Kullu vacation
Post by Pradip
We have hired our own vehicle from private travellers and went at different locations. If possible, we have to hire one guide or we can get the complete information before plan the tour. 
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Lahaul and Spiti





Keylong in November
Post by Madhuri | Mumbai | May 24, 2008
One of the best ways is to take a taxi from Manali, as it allows you the flexibility of stopping wherever you want to. One can also get buses which ply from Manali. Manali itself can be reached by air from Delhi, or by Volvo buses from Delhi and Chandigarh. One should avoid the region between November to May, because everything is closed down at the time, and you might find yourself unable to get out of Spiti until Rohtang opens up again.
Read full review 







A world out of this World
Post by Dr.shekhar | Jaipur | Apr 28, 2006
To visit lahaul and spiti it is best to approach it from manali via rohtang pass. There are taxi services available from manali. On your own, one must go in a qualis or sumo or any four by four vehicle as the terrain is very tough. A driver experienced in such terrain is a must. Carry enough warm clothing, sleeping bags and dry rations so that in emergency survival is easier. Accomodations are very limited at Losar, Kaza and Tabo. As the trip involves altitude in excess of 14000 ft precautions about low oxygen and dizzyness should be taken. In general it is a rough trip so be warned.
Read full review 





Keylong - An ideal destination for nature lovers
Post by Coolman | Delhi | Oct 6, 2008
1. you can reach upto Kullu by air and then by pvt taxi or bus.
2. direct bus from delhi, volvo or any other deluxe bus. these buses normally takes 12-13 hrs to reach manali and from there Taxi or another bus although their is direct bus for Keylong also which takes around 24 hrs (avoid such a long journey and halt at either kullu or manali).
3.	By own vehicle. Total journey is around 1400 kms (to and fro) and one can take halt at kullu or manali. Get your vehicle serviced b4 departure. Prefer 4X4 vehicle although we went in Alto
Read full review 







Walk on the Wild Side
Post by Anshuman
How to reach ?
The nearest international airport is at Delhi. From here one can either, catch a flight (once a day) to Bhuntar (Manali) airport, in Himachal Pradesh and take a taxi to Manali or take an over night bus from Delhi to Manali (12 hrs). With a days stop at Manali, one can start for Kaza the next day morning either by the bus that leaves at 5:30 am (12 hrs) or take a taxi which comes at a price of Rs. 3000-4000. Once you are in Kaza; Kibber, Ki Gompa, Tabo and Dhankar Gompa can be reached by using the local buses and taxis. Foreigners require Inner Line Permits which are easily available at the magistrates office in Kaza.
Regional Weather and Best Time to Visit
Spiti is cut off from the main State for almost up to eight months of the year due to heavy snow. However the best time to visit is between June and mid October. During the rest of the year, frequent landslides and flooding, block the route giving travelers a chance to hike some of the way. The climate is typically that of a desert, hot in the day with very bright sun and cold in the nights with chilly winds.
Places to stay in Kaza
Hill View Guest House is highly recommended.
HPTDC Tourist Lodge is a high end choice (tel +91-1906-222566)
Snow Line Hotel and Little Italy Restaurant (tel +91-1906-222257)
Places to stay in Kibber
Norling Guest house is highly recommended for its good rooms and clean western toilets. The owner is a Buddhist monk (Tseten Lama) and loves trekking. He is familiar with the whole region like the back of his hand. He also works as a guide, for treks or visits to nearby gompas and can arrange for tents, rations, stove, etc if pre informed (tel +91-1906-226242)
Read full review 





Spiti - The Silver River
Post by Tom
Reaching spiti is as much of a journey as your journey in Spiti and involves overnight buses from Delhi - Shimla / Manali and then a further 16hrs by taxi to Kaza the capital.
I opted to have Lara pick me up in Manali so we began the trip as soon as we cross the Kunzum la pass, stopping at Chandertal Lake *full Moon lake* and some of the cute villages immediately.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Manali





It Is Enchanting As Ever Before
Post by Kulwant | Noida | Jun 10, 2011
I travelled from Delhi - Chandigarh by morning Shatabadi Train separture at 7.40. Reached Chandigarh at 11.15 in the morning & started our onward journey to Manali in Pre- booked Cab. It Is 10 hours long journey covering distance of 310 km. in between 2-3 stoppages for lunch , tea, refreshments etc... Reached Manali hotel at 9.30 in night & transferred to our rooms within 10 minutes of our arrival. The manager himself was waiting on the reception for our arrival , he often queried about our arrival time while we were on our way to Manali.After refreshing ourselves ,had light dinner in hotel restaurant & straight away hit the bed as it was 10.30 already & we had to get up at 3'o clock early morning to go to Rohtang Pass. The precautions one should take while travelling to & in Manali is , first travel light stomach , dont gulp heavy fried dishes before & during the journey. good for you health & others too.Or you may while sick .Carry light woolens while travelling, Beacuse weather in & around Manali can change in no time.It is my personal advise to all the tourists that they should visit this place only if you are physically fit enough to face the rough road & weather conditions.Best time to visit this place is between May - June & if you love to enjoy only snow than October - December. Well that's all for now . Have a happy & safe journey to Manali. It is definitely worth visiting this place at least once in your life time
Read full review 







SWITZERLAND OF INDIA - MANALI !!!
Post by Kulwant | Noida | Jun 5, 2007
It was not easy decision to make of how to travel from Delhi  Manali & visiting sightseeings. Well as I mentioned that I have to keep my budget in control. So after a brief research I decided to break my journey in to 2 parts .Initially I was left with 3 options to choose from. First option was to take a direct deluxe bus from Delhi  Manali , travellling 16 hours by bus & that too most of the night journey & about 100 kms. Of mountain road & same journey schedule for coming back gave me creeps. The other point which I would like to make is that suppose if this journey is to be made by my friends who dont belong to delhi but are coming from Kolkata, Chennai , Hyderabd , Bangalore etc.. Already travelled a long distance to reach Delhi & from their onwards this journey by bus could be a real tiring & there are chances that you may get sick. So, this option was dropped instantly. The second option was to travel by train from delhi  chandigarh & then by car from Chandigarh  manali .But again this option was dropped when gathered information that the train timings & then travel by car to manali doesnt click together & doesnt suit us , again the night journey by road was involved, you guys must be thinking why I am not in favor of night journey , the reason is simple guys if you travel at night by road you are going to miss the most beautiful sightseeings on the way to Manali, so travel in day time & reach manali by evening admiring the natures beauty all the way . So the 3rd & the only best option left was to travel by train from Delhi  Pathankot & then by car from Pathankot  Manali. This turned out be a perfect travelling plan for us & I am thankful to god for making it such a pleasant trip.The route which we shall follow to manali was Pathankot  Palampur  Jogindernagar  Mandi  Kullu  Manali . The route itself made us feel excited that what kind of sights we shall be witnessing all the way.Just about 100 metres away from club house there is a small restaurant called Tibet kitchen on the roadside. we decided to have our lunch at this place. The food was really good .
Read full review 







Manali -- Peace, Tranquility & Snow In Abundance
Post by Samudra | Lucknow | Jun 8, 2006
Manali is almost 575 km from Delhi and takes anything from 14-16 hours non-stop drive. With children or senior citizens plan to stopover midway for the night at Swarghat or Bilaspur [HPTDC Hotels avl] with advance booking. For Rohtang, start early at 0500hrs. to beat the crowd and watch the first golden rays of the sun kiss the mountain peaks. Negotiate hard with the woollen dress shops, sledge and ski rides at Rohtang and the horse rides at Solang Valley. Don't forget to taste the Yak Cheese [Rs.700/kg] at the German Bakery on the Mall.
Read full review 





Manali- Abode of Gods
Post by Aseem | Kolhapur | May 20, 2006
Though flights are available to Bhuntar a place about 50 Kms form Manali, it is accessible by road from Chandigarh or Pathankot. I recommend Pathankot to Manali via Palampur, Baijnath, Jogindernagar, Mandi and Kullu. If you have time you can take a toy train journey from Pathankot to Jogindernagar. It is about 8 hours of relaxed driving through tea gardens, tall pine trees, plenty of small streams till you hit Mandi. From Mandi till Manali you have River Beas roaring in breathtaking rapids along the roadside. Winding road through pines, orchards of apples and exuberance of wild flowers make you feel as if the drive should continue.
Read full review 





Unforgettable memories
Post by Serena | Mumbai | Jun 21, 2012
Manali is best reached by bus from Delhi. An overnight journey is most advisable so that you can make the most of the next day. We wanted to avoid the summer rush and hence opted for a winter holiday when the place is not so crowded. Summer (April-May) is peak season and everything is at its peak - the prices, the crowds etc. the main attraction Rohtang Pass is usually closed in winters other than that you can enjoy everything else at leisure during the december-January months, only remember to carry lots of warm clothes.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Khajuraho





Khajuraho - Poetry sculpted on stone - bold and beautiful
Post by Abhijit | Gurgaon | Oct 23, 2010
Avoid the place during extended summer season. Otherwise, the weather is quite pleasant. Avoid the local touts and some of the guides. They seem to over-emphasize the erotic sculptures with added spices. That gets a bit irritating and one actually misses the beauty of the scenes, which can be enjoyed with minimum words. The poetry is already written in the stone and you do not need any interpreter to understand the same. It is best to buy the World Heritage Series book on Khajuraho. The book is by Archaeological Survey of India. That is the best available book for the general tourist. Also, it is worth taking a local taxi-driver, as they know the places well. Without their help, one cannot see the Southern and Eastern group of temples. Remember to see the location of old Khajuraho village and the Ghantai temple. An extended weekend worth spending.
Read full review 





Sculptings that seem better than the DaVinci and Michealangelo, to me.
Post by Suresh | Bangalore | Sep 27, 2010
We went by Rajdhani from Bangalore to Jhansi. The train arrived at 1am on the third day. Our travel agent had arranged a nice A/C car to take us to a hotel in Orchha. Next day, after sightseeing the palaces in Orchha, we left at 12 noon and arrived in Khajuraho at 5pm. In between, there was a lunch stop at a very nice Coffee Shop Restaurant cum Gift Shop, about 60 km from Khajuraho.
Read full review 







Most underrated destination
Post by Prema | Mumbai | Dec 5, 2007
The best time of the year to visit is October to March, when the weather is pleasant. The summers are too hot and not good for sightseeing. Air is the best way to reach. There are daily flights from Delhi of Indian and Jet. Soon Kingfisher too will be starting services. A rail line is expected in 2008 to come right into the town from Jhansi and should improve the connectivity.
Read full review 





Khajuraho Temples!
Post by Sudhir | Noida | Nov 13, 2011
One can go to Khajuraho from Delhi or Mumbai by morning flights which are very convenient. An evening overnight train from Nijamuddin arrives Khajuraho in the morning and is quite convenient.
Read full review 





Mesmerizing temple architecture
Post by Arpit | Ghaziabad | Apr 7, 2013
we travelled on march 2013 from gwalior to khajura via Datia, jhansi...and the road near to Datia and datia to jhansi is NO ROAD at all. it was all under construction and i heard it has been like this for 1 year almost. So in case you are travelling from Gwalior to khajurao - kindly check condition of road near Datia and jhansi and in case it is bad, you can take the route from Gwalior to Shivpuri to khajurao - this road is lengthy by around 100km but shivpuri to jhansi is excellent toll road with 4 lane highway (2 lane each side) and you will finally endup in saving time as compared to travelling at around 10km/hr average over that bad stretch of road and if you do not have a SUV kind of vehicle you always have a risk of car breakdown on that extremely bad road stretch.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Orchha





Orchha - a hidden destination
Post by Abhijit | Gurgaon | Aug 12, 2012
Orchha is considered as added bonus during Khajuraho trip  however, it deserves more attention. Monsoon is one of the best times for visit, followed by winter. Summer is definitely avoidable. This takes only 30 minutes from Jhansi railway station. Bhopal Shatabdi is the best option  where you can reach Orchha by 11:30 AM in the morning. During monsoon, sometimes the Betwa River gets overflowing and start flowing above the bridge. Hence, one should avoid crossing the bridge and going to the forest  even when the bridge is accessible. 
Read full review 





Orchha means achha
Post by Pradeep | Delhi | Feb 17, 2007
jhansi is nearest railwaystation and airport. Orchha is 20km from jhansi, 15km from jhansi bus stand. Delhi to jhansi satabdi exp is an option and taj express. Taxi or three wheeler bargaining is required. winter is right time to go
Read full review 





Heritage at its best
Post by Arpit | Ghaziabad | Apr 7, 2013
if coming from gwalior do checkout on road before Datia and between datia and jhansi, as we travelled during march 2013 and this was no road at all. It was very very difficult with medium sized hatchback car to commute, as you have to always decide should you put your front wheels or back wheels of car into which pot hole on road. it was actually no road at all. if road is very bad, try to go via shivpuri which will be 100km extra, but road is excellent you will endup saving time at the end and also prevent your car from breakdown.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Mandu



MANDU - STILL UNSPOILED
Post by Vinod | Agra | Jul 30, 2011
Travel possible by road only. About 100Km from Indore. If personal vehicle is not available buses ply quite often from Indore. Avoid travelling at night because of the tribal area and hilly road.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Faridkot



Faridkot - cool place
Post by Raghbir
Train from Delhi, Amritsar, Ferozpur, Ludhiana, Jalandhar.
Well conected by road from Ludhiana, Chandigarh, Bhatinda, Muktsar, Ferozpur, Guruharsahai and Amritsar. It is on NH-16.
Read full review 







Faridkot with Blessings of Baba Farid
Post by Kirandeep | Chandigarh | Sep 23, 2012
Book ur hotel room in advance, its just a small town with few hotels
take a round to the villages around Faridkot
green fields of villages will charm u
book ur train adv PUNJAB MAIL from delhi very few AC berths
reach by Bus from Ludhiana/ Chandigarh nice ac buses available

Read full review

Travelling Tips to Ajmer





Holy Ajmer Dargah
Post by Barish kohinoor
Don't rely on the autorickshaw drivers, rickshaw pullers who will forcibly make arrangements for accommodation at Ajmer. You can approach directly to a lot of choices of hotels without a mediator to avoid cheating.
Read full review 







Dargah e Ajmer
Post by Priyanka | Bangalore | Jul 25, 2008
How to Get There:
Best is to take the Delhi-Ajmer Shatabdi. That way you reach Ajmer at noon and after checking in to your hotel/ guest house, you can visit the Dargah in the evening (Best time to be there). There are also Taxis from Jaipur or even luxury buses
Where to Stay:
Luxury lovers should choose Mansingh Palace, Phoolmahal Palace or Roopangarh Fort
For Budget travellers I recommend the RTDC Hotels. These are really good.
Read full review 







Ajmer Dargah
Post by Barish kohinoor
You can reach Jaipur by air. From there you can proceed to Ajmer by train/car/bus which will take around three hours. The best hotel to stay in Jaipur is Hotel Shikha, Opp: Deer Park, behind the Secretariat. At Ajmer reasonably priced good hotels are available close to Dargah. Please avoid mediators like autorickshaw drivers, rikshaw pullers etc- to find any hotel.
Read full review 





Beware of pick pockets..
Post by Pradeep | Aligarh | Nov 10, 2011
From railway station its just 2 km walking distance. Its a very busy place so its better to go by feet instead of rickshaw or auto.One warning for each and every place beware of pick pockets & innocent looking beggars.
Read full review 





Memorable Journey
Post by Himanshu | Delhi | Feb 9, 2013
I traveled from Delhi to Ajmer in Duronto which I find to be best train ever. Try to book your seats well in Advance. At Ajmer you can find local transport at any point of time. Happy Journey.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Alwar



Weekend Getaway
Post by Umesh | Gurgaon | Dec 29, 2011
Alwar railway station is in the heart of the city. It is well-connected to Jaipur and Delhi
Alwar is well-connected to all cities in Rajasthan by state owned bus services. Special private buses are available to Alwar from Jaipur. Bus facilities are viable from 5 am to 10 pm in most of the days.
Alwar is well connected by State Highways to nearby places.
Read full review 





Alwar Experience
Post by Surajit | Delhi | Jan 20, 2013
Close to Delhi (approx 2 hrs drive). Roads have improved now and the drive is pleasant. You may opt for the Delhi - Jaipur highway or the state highway.
Read full review 







Industrial town 
Post by Ritwick | Kolkata | Jul 6, 2011
This place is 55 km from Delhi airport. The road after Gurgaon is dug up for expansion. Don't travel between 11p.m to 6 a.m since the trucks ply on the road and the road is chock a block at this time.
Read full review 





My cool trip
Post by Anil | Delhi | Feb 25, 2013
It is just a 2 hour travel from gurgaon with a average driving speed around 60-80 and the road conditions are very good other than the daruhera town wherein you may evidence traffic conditions sometimes and rarely at manesar town Do remember the turn wherein you have to take for neemrana industrial area as it is not a clear road but just appears to be a divider rather just 500 meters once you enter Neemrana Industrial area in highway
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Chittorgarh



Nice place
Post by Manoj  | Bangalore | Feb 9, 2013
Shoes compulsary, good camera with huge battery back up if you are a photography crazy person. Travel you can from anywhere in Rajasthan. Food is oily and fatty, need to keep watch on the calories. Do not shop inside the fort or palace, go to the local market if needed. Hotels are expensive for the quality, service and facility they provide. Food in these hotels are on match with 5 star hotels.
Read full review

Best way to travel from Bangalore to Jaipur
Jaipur is located at a distance of 1998 km from Bangalore. Jaipur, the Pink City, is well-connected to Bangalore by air, rail and road.
However, the best way to reach Jaipur from Bangalore is by air. You can board any of the direct flights from Bangalore and reach Jaipur in about 4 hours. Almost all airlines operate daily flights from Bangalore to Jaipur. 
Travelling Tips to Jaipur



The Pink Wonder
Post by Suhani | Jaipur | May 19, 2006
Very well connected by road, rail or air, Jaipur is 238 kms from Delhi. Luxury buses ply to and from Jaipur every 2 hours. But for rail or air travel, do get your tickets booked well in advance.
Read full review 





Best tourist friendliness
Post by Ravi | Bangalore | Apr 17, 2012
by air and train all major cities are accessible. taxis are available via delhi if u include delhi on the list. check weather before going. reach before late night.
Read full review 





Rasjasthan ka dil
Post by Mona | Faridabad | Dec 7, 2011
While going to Jaipur one must Visit Chowkidhani the typical rajasthani food restraunt.Since while coming back from Jaipur it not a good idea because they serve the food from 6pm onwards -10pm.Also the different foods & snacks in jaipur has more chillies in it than an average person can take so care must be taken while indulding into a lot of food.Jaipur can be reached by Train /car.Flight is not a good idea as its very near. I personally loved the journey from Delhi -Jaipur and back to Delhi in a car with my family.The warning is one must carry the correct route map of the hotel where you will stay ,we really had a hard time finding our hotel in jaipur & landed up at chandpol 4 times in the city. Must take a guide while sight seeing it saves a lot of time and one can cover up al ot of places in as short span.That was Jaipur really 'Rajasthan ka dil'
Read full review 







Historical Jaipur
Post by Wanderlust
And yes, dont forget to bargain with the rickshaw drivers. The cabs and rickshaws are quite quite expensive and one needs to be sharp while dealing with them. So also the coolies. But one cant do much as far as coolies go since the exorbitant rates seem to be premeditated.
Read full review 





So many things to see, but.........
Post by Rohit | Bangalore | May 9, 2008
Jaipur is an extremely tourist friendly place for foreigners, not so for Indians. So be mentally prepared. Credit Card machines do not work if you are an Indian, so carry sufficient cash. For Handicrafts - do visit the Rajasthali only on Ajmeri Gate. The other Rajasthali's are not govt run. The one on Ajmeri gate has a eye popping collection of handicraft. If you are the bargaining type, go to Johari Bazar or the Market opp Hawa Mahal. Keep in mind that the prices quoted are atleast 2 times more than the actual price, so bargain to your hearts content.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Jodhpur



Best Tour Of Rajastan.
Post by Captain.ramachandra. | Bangalore | Jan 22, 2013
Winters are heavy. Carry good Sweaters and Jackets. Try to engage taxi. Better to start from Delhi or from Jaipur as the center place for all directions. Better to travel in Feb/March.
Read full review 





Live like a maharaja
Post by Megha | Mumbai | Jan 19, 2013
From Mumbai, suryanagri express or ranakpur express trains which are a good travel, overnight journey. Best would be to fly down, the landscape from the plane is worth a watch. Internal city commute is expensive but I guess that is their sole earnings - tourism.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Kota





Kota The City of Classes
Post by Abhijit
Kota is well connected from all destination Delhi Mumbai Jaipur Trivandrum BangaloreMysore
Travel warnings Horrible experience in winter due to late running of trains due to fog in north
Try trains which terminate at Jaipur.
Read full review 





A complete city Kota.
Post by Sandeep | Delhi | Dec 22, 2012
Kota people use Oily food like fried Kachories and Gatta sabzi etc sp if you do not like oil then be you can have alternates as well like you find in Metropolotian City. Very Tasty Food Guys. Enjoy.. :)
Read full review 





Affordable royal living
Post by Meeta | Delhi | Dec 21, 2012
Kota is connected by roads, trains. for weather- December is warm, but January will see a chilly month. April to September should be avoided as its very hot there.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Kumbhalgarh



kumbhalgarh nice place to visit
Post by Ank | Ahmedabad | Mar 25, 2009
By Udaipur and via Nathdawara also. Udaipur ( Sukhadia circle to Fathehpur Choraya. Go for 100 mtr straight and then left turn for Iswal, Losing, Barwara, Odda, Kelwara. From Kelwara its takes 4-5 km and if you go by Nathdawara turn before Kankroli for Kelwara.
Read full review 





The Unconquered
Post by VS | Baroda | Jan 11, 2008
A drive from Udaipur is comfortable. Winter travel would be recommended like all towns in Rajasthan. Udaipur is connected by air, rail and road from all major cities.
Read full review 





best place
Post by Nilesh | Ahmedabad | Jan 11, 2013
It was a neat experience eating our dinner on the rooftop looking up at the fort lit up above. The meal was all vegetarian with tiny little eggplants and some delicious carrots. 
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Flights


Total distance:1583 km Nearest Airport:Agra 







Bus


Total distance:1583 km 





Taxi


Total distance:1583 km Price:from Rs. 6 per km  





Trains


Best trains to take:Kongu Express (12647), Karnataka Express (12627)  Last station:Agra Total distance:1583 km 


 

Hotels


Hotels:
 199 Hotel |  54 Guesthouses |  9 Homestays

Hotel reviews: 851 Awards: 13 of 270 hotels won Best of 2012 award 








Travelling Tips to Agra



A Journey into the centuries gone by--Destination Agra
Post by Ravi | Gurgaon | May 2, 2006
Agra is well-connected with all major cities of India. You must avoid the summer months as it is extremely hot there. Also beware of touts who will try to take you to particular hotels or shops.
Read full review 







Agra - the place of Taj
Post by Sumit | Kolkata | May 25, 2011
Agra is well connected by train. Agra contonment, Agra fort stations cater to numerous trains. The local Kheria Airport, is not a busy one. The nearest airport for all aspect is New Delhi, about 250 kms. By road, Agra is well connected with Delhi (NH2 & NH8), Jaipur, Gwalior.
Read full review 





Beautiful, Historic City
Post by Vimal | Thiruvananthapuram | Mar 3, 2012
Well connected by Rail, By road to Delhi in 3 hours on the new expressway.
Be careful with your wallets at all time, and footwear when you have to leave it for entering some of the monuments.
Read full review 







City of Taj
Post by Bose | Kolkata | Mar 25, 2009
Best time to travel is in between September and February. Try to reach with enough time in hand to search for a hotel. Be sure to check the tarrif before any transactions.
Read full review 





Dream come true
Post by Pradeep | Bangalore | Nov 24, 2011
Taj is closed on Friday for visitors to make sure you keep this in mind. Best time to see Taj is early in the day, as rays of run fall on the shrine it looks good. As the day goes by it will be difficult as shadow comes in between to take any photo. Nights can get cold so get your gears ready.I feel best time to visit Taj is Feb or early March.

Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Bareilly





A spiritual destination 
Post by Shadab
By Rail/Train
Bareilly falls on the busy Delhi-Kolkata line and is therefore well connected to most of the destinations in Uttar Pradesh and India. The main railway station in Bareilly is Bareilly Cantonment Junction. The junction is well connected to cities like New Delhi, Agra, Kanpur, Lucknow, Benaras, Jaipur, Kolkata and Mumbai through a cluster of super fast and express trains.
By Road
Bareilly is well connected to cities in Uttar Pradesh and around through a network of National and State Highways. The city has regular buses to destinations like Jaipur, Agra, Mathura, Ghaziabad, New Delhi, Lucknow and Varanasi. Both Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation as well as private parties ply buses to and from the city.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Almora



BINSAR - Best Place in Uttaranchal
Post by Anand | Delhi | May 18, 2006
Binsar is about 400 kms from Delhi via Moradabad, Rampur, Udham Singh Nagar, Haldwani, Bhowali, Garampani and Almora. It is 25 kms from Almora on the Bagheshwar Road and 2 kms after Kaparkhan Village. From Almora, there are two roads to approach it. One is the main Bagheshwar Road and the second one goes past the Kasar Devi temple. This road is much more picturesque and is recommended. A forest check post would welcome you at the entrance to the Binsar hill as it is a protected wildlife sanctuary but i wonder if there is much wildlife there apart from birds. The roads are very good, in fact excellent till Almora. It would take about 10-11 hours from Delhi and 4 - 4.5 hours from Haldwani.
Read full review 





Almora and binsar
Post by Sandipan | Kolkata | Jan 7, 2013
Lots of buses and jeeps start from Haldwani which can be reached overnight from Delhi and Lucknow by bus/ train. It takes about 3-4 hours from Haldwani
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Auli



Majestic Mountains, Serene Snow and Scorching Sun
Post by Kanchan | Bangalore | Feb 22, 2008
Auli is about 500 kms from Delhi by road through some of the most rugged, mighty and brown mountains you will ever see. The roads are mostly good but downright non-existent at a few places. One can reach Haridwar by an overnight train from Delhi and hire a cab or take the State Transport bus from there to Joshimath. Joshimath to Auli is by the famous cable car  be sure to check the timings for the rides up and down.
A bus is not a good option for people looking for a comfortable drive and if they suffer from mountain sickness. If not this, one can drive all the way from Delhi to Joshimath through Haridwar-Rishikesh-Devprayag-Srinagar-Rudraprayag-Karnaprayag-Nandaprayag-Chamoli and Pipalkoti. You can stop at any of these towns for a roadside meal or a hot cup of spiced tea.
After Rishikesh the entire drive is in the mountains with views along the way to die for. You will find a number of mesmerizing photo-ops on the way. Huge mountains with the Alaknanda giving you company all the way are a feast for the eyes. Devprayag where the Alaknanda and Bhagirathi meet and form the Ganges is a good place to stop. Be sure to walk down to the Sangam and behold this mightiest of Indian rivers.
The entire drive can take around 13 to 16 hrs depending on number of stops and speed. You will need to break journey as driving in the hills is prohibited from 8 pm to 5:30 am.
Warning: Watch out for Land slides! Carry heavy duty woollens during winters  the locals are used to the cold, you are not. Carry a strip of Avomine if prone to mountain sickness.
Read full review 





Auli.... beautiful location after Kashmir in India
Post by Jayshree | Mumbai | Mar 25, 2012
To reach Auli, you have to reach Haridwar, From ther u can either hire share or can hv pvt taxi to reach Joshimath... Form Joshimath by car or rope way.
Be careful As the destination is in top of mountain, local transport is very expensive.. if possible do carry enough money.

Read full review 





AULI ( PARADISE FOR NATURE LOVERS )
Post by Sidharth | Delhi | Feb 9, 2011
Drive from Rishikesh to Joshimath. The drive is about 10-12 hrs depending on the class of vehicle and the roads. From Joshimath there are two alternatives to reach Auli. 1. By road takes about 1.5-2.0 hrs and is about 14 kms, which is quite treachorous. After the winter games probably would have improved. 2. Take the longest ropeway in the world from Joshimath to Auli.
Read full review 







A lifetime gift to yourselves
Post by Shrirang | Aurangabad | Mar 16, 2007
From Haridwar about 280 km, hilly terrain and breathtaking Ghats through out the journey; be prepared for landslides with adequate food and water in case you get stuck up. Although help is easily available, keep emergency phone nos handy.
Read full review 





Paradise on earth..
Post by Jigar | Mumbai | Dec 24, 2012
Cary sufficient warm clothes as the nights are super chilly even in march. the roads are a bit bumpy. Clifftop people come to pick you up. Just call them.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Bhimtal





Bhimtal - A relaxed get-away
Post by Priya | Chennai | Jul 5, 2011
Check the weather conditions first - if you are expecting a hill station like weather, this is not the place. The place is dry and can get hot at times.
Read full review 





Bhimtal: Off the Beaten Track
Post by Ashima | Delhi | Jan 15, 2007
One can travel by road to Bhimtal or [and this is my favourite mode of travel!] take the overnight train, Ranikhet Express till Kathgodam and then take a cab till bhimtal [drive of about 45 minutes]. Negotiate a good rate with the cab person..they are agreeable to charing on a per head basis also and one can share a cab with other people!
Read full review 


Read more reviews
