Travelling Tips to Binsar



Surreal
Post by Suman | Gurgaon | Sep 4, 2012
October seems like the ideal time to visit Binsar, with clear blue sky, bright sunlight and chilly evenings. One can take a road trip from Delhi which should take 9-10 hours. The roads have been recently constructed and are a joy to drive...
Read full review 





An idyllic getaway
Post by Vasanth | Delhi | Oct 4, 2010
From delhi, one can drive down provided the weather is fine. the roads are in good condition so driving won't be a problem. the distance from delhi is roughly 400 km. Other easier option is to take the overnight kathgodam express and hire a cab from kathgodam. From here, Binsar is roughly 2 hours away. Regular buses also ply from Delhi till Almora.
Read full review 





Whiff of Paradise
Post by Gitanjali | Kolkata | May 31, 2006
Haldwani is best connected by trains to Delhi and dehradoon. Then cars and buses will take you to Binsar. Take warm clothes and wear trekking shoes on the outdoor trips.
Read full review 





A heaven of pine trees.
Post by Noopur
It takes 10-12 hrs by road from Delhi.A better option is to take an overnight train to kathgodam n take a cab from there. takes just a couple of hours from there. Much more comfortable and you save a day.
Read full review 







Away from civilization
Post by Vaderaj | Bangalore | Jun 2, 2011
It is about 30 kms from Almora and 50 kms from Bageshwar. The road from both sides are pretty good but if you are starting from Nainital side and coming to Binsar the roads upto Almora is pretty bad. The rains have torn it apart last year (2010) and will not be fixed this year also. Looks like it will be a couple of years before things are okay. This sector is much better than the Nainital surrounding areas (too many curvy roads).
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Munsiyari- Himalaya Peaks Thrill
Post by Shashank | Delhi | Sep 7, 2007
First of all never travel by car; it was nice for me but torture for my wife and kid and bro/sis-in-law as it took me around 21 hours to reach my KMVN Hotel; its advisable to reach Almora by train and then take anything available to reach you there; although I am driving freak and this was pretty tiring and I was half dead at conclusion

Travelling Tips to Hemkund



Hemkund Sahib-Valley of Flowers
Post by Amit | Bangalore | Apr 28, 2006
Train to Haridwar. Long road journey to Govind ghat, 22 kms from Joshimath. One day trek to Gangharia. Hemkund is a 3-5 hour trek from Ghangaria. A fairly steep one. Valley of flowers is a 2-4 hour easy trek from Ghangaria. There are plenty of hotels and camping sites at Ghangaria.
Season for this trek is from April-Sept. Porters can be hired at Govindghat, Ghangaria or enroute to help you carry your bags or even you!! People can be transported by a horse/mule, on the back of a porter or even a palaquin kind of structure!
The route is fairly well marked, there are plenty of hikers and devotees taking on the same journey and several small shops selling snacks/food/water/etc.
Read full review 





The Valley of Flowers and Hemkund Sahib
Post by Rajan
access through roads from dehi and dehradun
closest airport- jollygrant , dehradun
closest railway station- rishikesh
trek of 18-20km from base camp(Govindghat)
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Kausani



A himalayan delight!
Post by Hetal | Mumbai | Apr 16, 2009
We visited Kausani from Nainital and it was a four hour drive through pleasant roads. However, if you are not accustomed to winding roads, it is advisable to take nausea medication beforehand. Kausani can be reached by road from Delhi, or by a few hours drive from Kathgodam railway station. The temperature was average when we visited in March end, but it is advisable to carry light woollen clothes as it can get pretty cold in the evenings and nights.
Read full review 





A fabulous destination
Post by Soumyajit | Delhi | Sep 30, 2012
August, September, October are the best months. Though a hill station, summer can be really warm as it is in a lower altitude than nainital. There is only one SBI atm in the town near the entry of the town. Tourists are better advised to use their atms in Almora. The SBI atm normally has money. However during peak seasons, one cannot guarantee. 
Read full review 





Trip to Heaven called 
Post by Watan 
If traveling in Winter, Please carry more than enough woolen than u think. If visiting keeping some adventurous activities in mind, then you will be disappointed but a great place to bust your stress of routine life. Take Ranikhet Express to Kathgodam from Old Delhi Railway station, then a cab to Kausani direct for about 146 kms and enjoy the ride but make sure to keep some pills to prevent 'vomitting' during ride and have them before you start the journey from kathgodam to kausani. 
Read full review 





kumaon visit
Post by Rajiv | Delhi | Oct 23, 2012
distance from nainital is 120 kms takes 4-5 hours to reach from there by road
avoid travelling in monsoons as area is hilly throughout and landslides are common then
Read full review 





 Kausani
Post by Monika | Delhi | Jun 15, 2012
Its about 5 hrs drive from Rampur and about 4 from Kathgodam but the journey is good. One can take an overnight train from Delhi & reach kathgodam/ Rampur and then have to take a taxi or a bus to reach Kausani.

Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Lansdowne





Scenic Lansdowne
Post by Suranjan | Delhi | Jun 24, 2011
Starting from Delhi->Ghaziabad->Modinagar->enter Merrut city go towards Begumpul take a right turn->carry on till Meerabagh take another right->carry on keeping an eye on Kubhmela Exp. Way on your left, you need not enter Bijnor->Kotdwar-> Duggada->Lansdowne.
Try to carry plenty of water, snacks. Try to complete your breakfast within the Bijnoe stretch. The hilly stretch starts only after Kotdwar. 
Read full review 







The clouded land
Post by Madhuri | Mumbai | Oct 10, 2010
To reach Lansdowne, the best way is to take the road from Delhi. The nearest rail-station is Kotdwar, which is almost 2.5-3 hrs away.
During the monsoons, there is good chance of Landslides, and hence advisable to travel in a more powerful car which can resist the strong flows of gushing water which sometime find their way to the road.
Read full review 







Lansdowne - Silent beauty of Valley!
Post by Giri | Delhi | Jul 7, 2009
Please refill fuel at Kotdwar before climbing to Lansdowne. There is no petrol pump at Lansdowne.
here is no restaurants are market around Tarakeshwar temple. Hence, plan it as such you were back to Lansdowne to have your food. Or, carry packed food with you.
You may get fresh seasonal fruits enroute. In July, we got fresh mangoes Rs.15 per kg. near Najibabad on the highway roadside.
In Bijnor Kwality restaurant on the highway is good to have food with family
Read full review 







The Sound of Silence
Post by Ranee | Goa | Sep 22, 2007
Light woolen clothing for summer and heavy woolen garments for winter. Carry rain protection gear in all seasons.
Well-connected by a motorable road - Delhi (295 km.), Haridwar (95 km.) & Dehradun (150 km.). Lansdowne is also linked by a motorable road to almost all the important cities in Uttaranchal. Delhi via Meerut, Mawana, Bijnor, Najibabad, Kotdwar on a good road most of the time! There are many eating places with clean restroom facilities. Crossing over the River Ramganga is awesome.
Read full review 





A perfect weekend getaway from delhi
Post by Nitish | Delhi | Aug 1, 2011
I traveled by Mussorie Express which takes entire night, if you are planning by this train, please get reservations done in 3AC ONLY, Use this mode if you can walk in mountains as it demands lot of walking to see the nature here, else drive to this place, roads between Kotdwar and Lansdown are in good condition.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Mukteshwar





Peora in Mukteshwar - serene and peaceful
Post by Abhijit | Gurgaon | Jun 14, 2009
We visited this place on the month of June. We drove from Delhi to Kathgodam and then hired a local driver cum guide. The driver was very knowledgeable about local roads as there are not sufficient road-signs in the village roads. This is a very important aspect on this area. As the roads are generally empty, one might not be able to know the exact route, unless they are familiar with this area.
Read full review 





Peora (off Mukteshwar) a destination less explored
Post by Navin | Mumbai | Oct 24, 2006
Nearest Rail Station is Kathgodam. From there a drive of 85km/2.5 Hrs via Bhawali, Garampani & Kwarab Bridge.
Straight drive from Delhi - 347km/08-09 Hrs via Moradabad, Rampur, Kathgodam, Bhawali & Garampani.
It is situated 23km from Almora and 10km from Mukteshwar on Almora-Mukteshwar road. Nainital is 50km away.
Ranikhet Exp connects Delhi & Kathgodam.
Read full review 





Mukteshwar
Post by Travel Freak | Delhi | Jan 4, 2010
Travel is very simple till Kathgodam, from there just after 5 kms there is a diversion, the staright one goes to Jeolikot-Nainital and the seocnd goes to Bhimtal. I went to Jeolikot (17 kms) and there is a diversion there, the left turn goes to Nainital and the straight (Ranikhet Highway) goes to Bhowali (17kms). From Bhowali take a right turn towards Ramgarh (13kms). From Ramgarh it startight upto Mukteshwar (25kms).
This route is 5kms longer than the Bhimtal one, but very less crowded of vehicles and driving is very easy.
I will recommend to prefer this route while going as it is much easier and the roads are fantastic.
Read full review 





PEORA A HIDDEN DESTINATION
Post by Debendra | Kolkata | Oct 6, 2006
You could drive straight from Delhi or reach Kathgodam by train and then take a car. Do not forget to recharge tank from khairna. Otherwise the nearest filling station will be at Almora.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Mussoorie



Mussoorie-Uttranchal visit March 2012
Post by Dharmesh | Mumbai | Mar 30, 2012
The GHAT as we term the road uphill is not in the best of shapes and under going repairs / new drainage lines....hope it gets completed before the vacation rush. Our hotel was Sterling Pine Hills and the direct road to the hotel was closed...hence had to go around a hill to reach our hotel.
Read full review 





Mussoorie-Queen of hills
Post by Jatin | Delhi | Sep 11, 2010
Travel Tips:
One should carry their warm clothes or atleast full sleeve shirts, shawls or caps. You will never be able to predict the weather of this place as most of the time of the year it is chilling and raining. Carrying a raincoat or umbrella would be an added advantage.
How to reach:
Mussoorie is conveniently connected by road to Delhi and major cities. It is called the 'Gateway' to Yamunotri and Gangotri Shrines of Northern India. The closest rail station is Dehradun. Taxis are easily available for Mussorie as are buses at regular intervals.
The best time to visit is from mid-March to mid-November though the downpours could be an inhibiting factor in the monsoon months of July to September.
Read full review 







Mussoorie in the pouring rain
Post by thera | Delhi | Aug 20, 2008
Delhi-Dehradun by Shatabdi train. Taxi to Mussoorie cost me 500 rupees. Hotel Shiva Continental cost me 1250/day and as I did not get a room with a view, shifted to a basic but really cute hotel Luxmount on the Mall road, with probably the best views in town. Check the pix. Oh, room cost was 500/day -bed, wardrobe, dresser, coffee table, 2 armchairs, TV, attached bath with hot and cold water. (No housekeeping service ofcourse!) Perfect for a budget traveller. For meals, visit the nearby restaurants and Coffee Cafe Day.
Read full review 





Mussoorie 'Queen of Hills'
Post by Ashish
Mussoorie is conveniently connected by road to Delhi and major cities. It is called the Gateway to Yamunotri and Gangotri Shrines of Northern India. The closest rail station is Dehradun. Taxis are easily available for Mussorie as are buses at regular intervals.
The best time to visit is from mid-March to mid-November though the downpours could be an inhibiting factor in the monsoon months of July to September.
Read full review 





Not So Cool as temp is Preety HOT.. Above 32 during day
Post by Narinder  | Chandigarh | Jun 23, 2012
Reach there in your own private vehicle. Dehradoon to Mussorrie is an interesting pass thru and one famous temple is also on the way. Do pay visit in between....
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Gulmarg



Beautiful Valleys & Snow Capped Mountains
Post by S.c. | Rourkela | Dec 29, 2011
The place Gulmarg is well connected to Srinagar, which is reachable by air/road from Jammu/Delhi. You can take trains upto Jammu & then can have road drives thru longest tunnel of Asea. Air travel can be from Jammu & while approaching Srinagar, the view of the snow capped mountains will add thrills to you. For outdoor activities out in snow, cover yourself with adequate winter wears which is available for a price. Have snow goggles to avoid the blinding of eyes. Balance yourself while walking/skating on the snow, else the fall will be too much painful or may be worse. Don't talk a lot with each other which will make you to take more breaths & eventually tiring as the mountain air is thin with less oxygen compared to normal places at low altitude. Carry enough medicines for aches,colds & muscle cramps.
Read full review 





If there was heaven
Post by Sowjanya | Hyderabad | May 17, 2011
Gulmarg is a hilly area, so all those with breathlessness and other breathing problems, please ensure to carry your back up's.
As there is a lot to walk and climb, it is adviseble to have light food and warm clothing - as in winters the snow fall is very very heavy - and the strom gets crazy - so be mindful of it :)
Read full review 





Snow at Best !
Post by Hemanta | Bangalore | Mar 10, 2007
One can reach by road, Railway (up to Jammu) or by Air. Private Taxi is plenty. Kashimiri's are friendly people with lot of love, care and hospitality. Terrorism and Terrorist are the problem.
Read full review 





Paradise on earth
Post by Anushka | Mumbai | Mar 21, 2013
Flights are invariable late as weather is unpredictable. From srinagar airport it's almost 2-2 1/2 hrs journey as in winter on snow cladded road one can not drive fast.There is a restriction for private vehicle entry in gulmarg. We have hired travel car from airport which dropped us at the base of gulmarg (I forgot the name of that area), from this point there r sumo's which takes us up in the mountain of gulmarg. this journey is scenic & all these vehicles are driven by locals who are experts in driving on snow cladded road.One has to negotiate on rates. Carry sufficient water, snacks if traveling with kids as very few shops r available on road.
Read full review 





Prabhakar Iyer & family at gulmarg
Post by Prabhakar
The best way to reach is taxi or hired cabs from Srinagar and the journey is wonderful and do not take much time.Of course you can reach Srinagar either by Air or by Train.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Kashmir



Paradise Personified
Post by Poornima | Agra | Jun 28, 2012
Flying is the best option if you book tickets before they touch skies. Train is also a good option if you can bear a day and night journey before you reach there. To go to gulmerg, sonmarg and pahelgoan hire a cab to and fro. It is ideal to reach there by 10am to enjoy the engagements there. The Gondola ride closes at 4pm so it is advisable to leave early for your destinations. To see the local spots in Srinagar, hire an auto, it can take you anywhere and everywhere you want it to.

Read full review 





Truly 'Heaven-on-Earth'!!
Post by Kanupriya | Mumbai | Aug 6, 2008
The best mode to travel is to take a flight from Delhi to Srinagar. And from Srinagar, you can hire a car for further travel. We first went to Jammu from Delhi to visit the Vaishno Devi Temple and from Jammu, we went by car to Srinagar. Believe me, the journey was really painful. A person with motion sickness just cant go through it. It took around 10 hours in the hills. So, it is preferable to go by flight.
Hotels are available suiting all budgets. You can stay at any one near the Dal Lake in Srinagar. Houseboats are also available in Dal lake but, they are quite smelly. In Pehalgam though, finding a hotel is difficult. Mostly small lodges are only there.
Kashmir has become very safe for tourists. So, there isnt anything to worry about. Hope you enjoy your trip!!
Read full review 





Trip to Jannat........Kashmir
Post by Viral | Pune | Jun 7, 2012
It's a wonderful time to visit Kashmir between 15th May to 15th June. You can visit all the places during this time. Snow is also available in Gulmarg & Sonmarg. Just make sure to book the hotels in advance as it's a vacation time and lots of people visits during this time.
Read full review 





Awesome Kashmir - truely heaven on earth
Post by Piya | Bangalore | Aug 23, 2012
We went by air from bangalore to srinagar and from there you get local cabs which will tk you to all the places. average they take 2500Rs per day for each location from Srinagar.
hotels are not a problem in srinagar but other places someties needs advance booking as few in number.

Read full review 





Heaven on Earth
Post by Mehul | Mumbai | Nov 16, 2011
It is important to check if at all there are any tensions in valley, if not even after traveling to Kashmir you should avoid going to terror prone area & strictly follow advice of your guide.For reaching to Kashmir from Mumbai you can book train tickets in Jammu Tawi which is direct train to Jammu & from there on its 8-9 hours road journey which is very scenic but equally tiring due to winding roads.
To avoid journey at a stretch you can take night halt at Patnitop which is very pleasant place & you will start getting a feel of kashmir.Avoid traveling during night.In case of flight you can travel from Mumbai to Srinagar which will be less painful & tickets are around 6-7,000 in case you book them in advance.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Katra



Katra - Base to heaven on Earth!
Post by HimanshuG | Delhi | Jun 1, 2006
Its well connected to Jammu by regular buses/jeeps, which is itself well connected by air/rail/road.
There are helicopter services from jammu to vaishnodevi as well, so the senior citizens can comfortably do their pilgrimages.
It gets pretty cold in winters, so keep that in mind.
Read full review 





Our memorable vaishno devi darshan
Post by Jayashree 
The best way to reach katra from anywhere is to get to Delhi and from delhi to Jammu. from Jammu there are taxis and buses plying to katra. Buses take 3 to 4 hours and taxis take 2 to 3 hours to reach katra. from katra vaishno devi darshan can be had by trekking up 14 km or by using dholi or pony. though when we went, due to bad weather the helicopter was not operating, this is the best option to avoid body ache and to save time. helicopter flies from katra to the bhawan and bookings for this can be done and this facility may be utilised.
Regarding travel warnings, only fear is landslide during bad weather
. 
Read full review 







Katra/Vaishno Devi Yatra.
Post by Sanjay | Ghaziabad | Nov 15, 2011
Some of the unpleasent experience i wish to share-
1 Always negotiate/verify the rates of poni/palki/ghora etc.I have been cheated during the trip.
2 from Jammu to Katra,if some one wants taxi,pl negotiate with them since We have been cheated during the trip.may be discussed more on telephone.
3 I fsome body is hiring ghora from Katra,he should opt helicopter service which is cheaper.

Read full review 





Wonderful trip to Katra
Post by Chirag
Very easy to reach Jammu by air, train or by road from Delhi or any other part of country. and many private to public vehicles are available to reach Katra from Jammu.
Read full review 





Jai Mata Di
Post by Deepika | Delhi | Dec 4, 2012
We usually travel by train from Delhi till Jammu and from there hire a taxi / bus. Katra is approx 1.5 hours away from Jammu. One should always carry woollens even in summers due to hilly area and uncertainty of weather.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Ladakh (Leh)





Heaven on earth
Post by Kartik | Delhi | May 10, 2008
One can travel by road via the Manali-Leh or Srinagar-Leh highways or take a flight to the Leh airport.
Carry a lot of warm clothes and be prepared for temperatures to plummet rapidly, especially when it becomes cloudy.
A word of caution  one should always take time to acclimatize to the surroundings. The first few hours in Leh should be spent sleeping or resting and relaxing, and only in the evening should one venture out to nearby areas. A full days rest in Leh is ideal. One should also avid exertion of all kinds, and if required take adequate rest.
One should also carry all possible medicines that may be required for the journey. Food is scarce and there are very few eating places in these areas, so adequate snacks and food items should be carried along. Intake of sufficient amount of water is essential and it makes sense to stock enough at the beginning of the road journey.
The routes to the passes are some times covered with slippery ice and one should be sure of the road conditions before planning travel to these areas.
Having said this, Ladakh is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful places on earth and is definitely a must-see for all.
Read full review 





Ladakh- The lunar paradise
Post by Giridharan | Thane | Jan 12, 2007
Reach: Air: from Delhi & Jammu. Road : from Srinagar or Manali.
Travel tips: Air travellers need 6-7 days of aclamatisation/ 3 days for road travellers. Drink lot of fluids. Oxygen levels are low. Take remedial medicines. One can take help from Army/ B.R.O detachments and MI rooms, in case of health needs. Proper authorisation to visit tourist sites need to be procured from Leh.
Warning: Advanced planning need to be meticulously done as the might of the mountain is very much visible; the itinerary might be thrown out of gear anytimes due to erratic weather changes. May need 3 weeks for satisfactory trip. Follow cautionary signs.
Read full review 





Magnificiant Leh
Post by Girish | Delhi | Nov 16, 2012
Please intake lot of water.
for first 2 days relax and take adequate sleep
don't allow yourself to get dehydrated. Many people take the water thing too far, imho.
Avoid alcohol if you are planning to trek. Also coffee. But tea is fantastic and plentiful.
Wash hands before and after meal with soap. Probably the most important tip. There are wash sinks in the restaurants and foreign tourists hardly ever use them but the locals do.
Buy your water from the two boiled water shops. Just ask people where they are when you get there. Its cheaper than bottled water too and will help keep the plastic rubbish problem down.
If trekking, take some alchol hand gel for hand washing in places where the conveniences are limited. Use detergents when you wash your dishes, but don't put them in the streams. Take the water away from the stream to rinse off your plates. Do not put any soapls or detergents in the streams.
Do not leave any rubbish, however small in the environment. Burn it or take it back to town.
Take usual small travellers first aid kit.
Take lip balm, sunblock, decent hat (not a cap) to prevent sunburn and dry skin.
I can't comment on the weather with any precision. Someone else will or do a search. 
Read full review 





Very near to the abode of peace
Post by Krishna | Kolkata | Jun 30, 2012
One must be very careful about high altitude sichness. One must take rest for atleast 48-72 hours with plenty of water 3-4 litres a day. As there is scanty of oxygen content in the air. You can reach there by air from Delhi or by road either from Manali or Srinagar.
Read full review 





Out of the World
Post by Nikhil | Mumbai | Jun 26, 2012
One should travel via Manali & should conclude enroute Kargil to Srinagar. One should carry heavy woolens, sun glasses, sun screen lotion, dry fruits for the personal use. One should drink minimum 3 litters of water daily to get oxygen & to keep oneself safe as oxygen is very low due to high altitude. People advice for high altitude medicines to carry but I will say only water drinking is the biggest safety for anyone. One should walk slowly after reaching, avoid tobacco as it obstruct your breathing power & also avoid alcohol as it dehydrates the body & again it makes difficult for the body to get the oxygen. One should also keep camphor to grow the breathing power.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Nubra Valley





Hunder & Diskit of Nubra valley
Post by VRV | Mumbai | Jul 15, 2011
Nubra is about 160 kms and car / private taxi takes about 5-6 hours to reach.
On the way, you pass through the snow laden Khardung La pas- the world's highest motorable road at over 18350 ft above sea level.Carry warm clothes if you wish to stop at Khardung La where you also find only one restaurant serving tea, Maggi and Momos.
Read full review 





Vertical Limits
Post by M.k.
Take the help of a reliable travel agency well in advance to care of your special permit to enter in the area, accommodation, transport. Best time to visit is between June-August.
Read full review 





Feels like heaven
Post by Pradyumna | Bangalore | Nov 28, 2012
Nubra valley is far from Leh city. If you book hotel in Leh you can't travel to Nubra valley on in single day. You need to make arrangement for accommodation while visiting Nubra valley.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Pahalgam





Pahalgam the Switzerland of India
Post by Parveen  | Bangalore | Jun 1, 2011
We need to hire a vehicle from Jammu to Patnitop and then to Pahalgam. This Journey will be enchanting with beautiful valleys, waterfalls, snowcapped mountain ranges etc. 
Read full review 







A Heavenly Experience!!
Post by Ankita | Nagpur | May 29, 2011
At the Srinagar airport, there are pre-paid taxis charging Rs. 1200-1500 (non-AC/AC). From there it's a hassle-free journey devoid of ghats on good roads through scenic locations and saffron fields. You can also buy the world-famous Kashmiri saffron and cricket bats made from Kashmiri willow it on your way. Ask your cab-driver for a good deal. The food served at dhabas is not good, just stop for tea/ snacks. Pack a sweater or two, yeah, even the summers are cold by the rest of India standards! A windsheeter would be best to fight the chilly winds, especially if you wanna go out in the evenings or night. Normal clothing will suffice for the day or if you stay indoors. Bargain with the shawl-wallahs and horsemen. They tend fix exorbitant prices. During river-rafting, you have to sign an undertaking saying that you are participating at your own risk. Please do not take kids below 10 as they are not covered in the undertaking.
Read full review 







Tiny Heaven on Earth
Post by Sumit | Kolkata | Mar 20, 2012
Pahalgam is only about 95 km from the Srinagar and about 255 km from the nearest major rail station Jammu. Srinagar is well connected from Delhi & Jammu through frequent flights. Jammu is also well connected from all the major cities. Journey from Jammu to Pahalgam takes about 8-9 hours while that from Sringar is 2-2.5 hours. Frequent bus services and private cars are available from both the places.
Read full review 





The sheer beauty of Pahalgam
Post by Mehul
Pahalgam can be reached from Srinagar in about 2-2.5 hrs.....in between, one can halt at pampore to appreciate the saffron plantations, then at Avantipore to see the ancient ruins....next halt at sangam to buy some genuine Kashmiri willow bats and finally a short detour from anantnag takes one to the hindu sun temple and ruins of Martand...all these places are definitely worth a short visit...
Read full review 







The Switzerland of India
Post by Parveen  | Bangalore | Jun 4, 2011
It is better to travel Pahalgam after doing the sight seeing of Jammu and Patnitop. The route to Pahalgam via Patnitop is awsome with deep valleys, streams, water falls, view of snow capped ranges etc.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Pangong



Pangong
Post by Rakhee
Leh is well connected by flights from Delhi, Jammu and Srinagar. The frequency and timings differ with each route and with each operating Airlines and it may also change during on and off season...
Who have breathing problem or asthma should avoid to visit this place. One should carry small cylinder of oxygen for emergency( not compusory) as lake of proper oxygen. take rest at least for 24 hrs to condition our selves with climate of that place. 
Read full review 





Surreal Beauty
Post by Hasan jawaid | Delhi | Aug 8, 2012
From Leh you can take a taxi to Pangong. Take a rugged vehicle for you would be riding on some very bumpy and bouncy terrain. Prepare well to ward off mountain sickness, for you would be travelling through the world's third highest motorable road -- the Changla Pass. Keep some medicines and eatables ready. Do not spend too much time on the Changla Pass, the air is thin and it is very cold, even in June. Keep warm clothes for Pangong too. It gets very cold in the evenings.
Be prepared to take hundreds of photographs. So, keep spare storage (memory cards etc) with you.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Patnitop



Patnitop a quiet paradise
Post by Ajay | Jammu | Apr 23, 2007
You can get a deluxe bus or a private taxi from Jammu. On way Rs.1000. Hotels range from 500 to 2000. If you want to stay in Govt. accommodation choose only dak bungalow rooms (800) or deluxe huts on the main site (1800-3000). Do not go to background huts. These are shabby. Bargain with the hotels. they may be cheap than what they ask.
Read full review 





Earth meets heaven!
Post by Sapna  | Ghaziabad | Dec 27, 2011
You can reach over there by road transport like bus, car.If travelling makes you nauseatic than prefer to have pills with you.Woollen clothes are also must during winters.
Read full review 





awesome
Post by Sanjiv | Mangalore | Dec 13, 2012
By bus from Katra( Vaishno devi), Jammu and srinagar or taxi from the same places.
Nearest railway station is Jammu.
Nearest airports are Srinagar and Jammu.

Read full review 





Incredible India! 
Post by Prerna
Don't forget to hire a Taxi either from Jammu or from Katra .We paid 4000 for the Taxi from Katra for two days in Patnitop and back to Jammu including sight seeing(Natha top,Sanasar in Patnitop,and Manser Lake on Udampur-Jammu highway).Good restaurants but if you choose a cottage then you can cook your self.Don't forget to take some ready to cook,tea bags and fun time.
Read full review 





Post by Dhanvesh | Delhi | Mar 21, 2013
If a person go to Maa Vashnodevi, that make a short trip to Patrnitop. It is just 90 KM and hire a local conveyance such as car and take wollen during winter season
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Sonamarg



Good to see
Post by Ramanujabhattar | Hyderabad | Aug 2, 2012
1,Carry good gloves, which are not available at SONAMARG.Others charges windcheater/coat,gumboots are available on rent. When we go to the GLACIER due to the extreme cold fingures become numb and since we,the travelers have no experience we tend to fall down and after the fall hands simply will not cooperate.
2.Don't expect any food at this place. Go prepared. While going back to
Srinagar also, the food available at most of the places is very bad.
3. Bargain while taking ponies(horses),cars on rent. You have no fixed rents in this place.
Read full review 







Sonamarg, The silvery Range
Post by Parveen  | Bangalore | Jun 4, 2011
We had gone to Sonamarg as a drive from srinagar and came in the evening but I wud advise the visitors to stay in this enchanting place for a overnight for sure and enjoy the serene beauty of this place.
Read full review 





Enroute-Destination Amarnath
Post by Pankaj
Flight to Srinagar,then by car to Sonamarg which is enroute to Baltal & Kargil.You must always have an experienced driver because of unforseen situations which may arise by itself.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Srinagar



Wonderful and an Exotic destination
Post by Pranav
It is advisable to do only window shopping one first day and then decide the worth of any item for yourself.
Avoid purchase on houseboats on day 1st of travel as they will be somewhat costleir, unless u are aware of market rates in advance.
Bargain on any item may range from 20-35% of the mentioned cost, except on fixed price shops, though we observed that 2-3 shops of fixed price were too unreasonable and had elevated prices upto 40-50%.
Dont bring too many cherries boxes in handbags on airport, as only one box per person is permssable. Indeed one can keep as many cherry boxes in their suitcases.
Strictly avoid carrying handbags for in flight travel as one will go a rigrous checking with consumption of lots of time on Srinagar airport. One may keep their valuables, cash and milk bottles of children in one handbag.
On the day of return from srinagar through Flight, leave your hotel atleast 3 hours before for airport (especially if u are with family) as there is rigrous checking (of all the luggages and individuals) at one point before airport (leading to Jams and excessive rush) and at 2-3 points inside airport. On an average a family may need atleast one hour inside the airport only to reach final clearance point.
Read full review 





srinagar- god's created valley heven
Post by Shaila | Mumbai | Feb 22, 2007
I took flight from mumbai-delhi-srinagar and back . However direct flights are also there. Be ready for many security checks in Srinagar. Otherwise it is safe provided you avoid roaming at late nights. Lal gate area has a very beautiful temple of shiva and godess [mata]
Read full review 







Please do not hesitate to visit Srinagar. Its absolutely cool now.
Post by Saibal | Kolkata | May 27, 2009
Mode of transport is Train Plain etc. From Kolkata we availed Train to Delhi and then to Jammu, we booked a Qualis from Jammu and visited Katra (Vaishnadevi), Patnitop (must see place for atleast 2 days. Stay at KTDC bunglow)Srinagar, Sonamarg, Gulmarg, Pahelgaon( 2 days) and back to Jammu. Rate of Qualis is 2000/- Sumo 1900/-. etc.
Read full review 







Gulmarg cable car
Post by Sankaraiah | Hyderabad | Oct 22, 2012
1. Better buy tickets in the Net.
2. Warm clothing, Gloves, shoes required
3. At 2nd stage, do not try to climb further more on foot to see LOC , it is a very difficult terrain.
4. Aged above 50, better to confine to stage one.
5. Carry light food.
Read full review 





Tour to kashmir
Post by Inderjit | Amritsar | May 30, 2012
Always start early and reach early.... I travelled by road. My first night stay was at Patnitop. The Hotels r expensive compared to the facilities.... better option is to stop at KUD that comes 4-5 km before patnitop.... you will get cheaper hotels.....if you reach at night they charge you more.
Second day in travelling to srinagar.....third day to gulmarg......again mind you that you must start early to get tickets for GONDOLA ride....and better take tickets upto the last point ...that will be Rs 800 per person.
fourth day to phelgam and chandanwari...... on the way you can enjoy rafting....fifth and sixth day can be kept for srinagar...dal lake....gardens...forts and monuments and shopping ofcourse......
Avoid taking shortcuts.....keep sufficient fuel in ur car.....Ask for guidance and help from police personnels ....they are really friendly and helpful.... Happy Touring.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Raipur





capital of chhattisgarh
Post by Ritesh
raipur is easily connected by air to all metros. Mumbai,delhi,kolkata,hyderabad, indore ,nagpur etc.
by railway also connected to all places.....
by road also connected NH 06.....
Read full review 





A Blissful Stay
Post by Santosh | Hyderabad | Mar 13, 2013
Just have your own vehicle as the public transport system is either abysmal or absent. Roads are in excellent condition specially the Naya Raipur sector and also travel with a guide or with a Navigator fitted to the vehicle as the Naya Raipur sector has deserted roads and one can easily lose his way.
Read full review

Baikunthpur Tour
Post by Nawin | Bangalore | Oct 19, 2010
The Nearest airport is Raipur. So many flights are connected to Delhi, Mumbai, Indore, Hydrabaad, Kolkata etc. Direct Trains are there from Raipur to Baikunthpur. Buses & Taxies facilities are available there.

Travelling Tips to Jagdalpur



A City of waterfalls and caves.
Post by Savitha
Jadalpur is Head Quarters of Batar district. Frequent Buses are available from state capital Raipur. Journey for about 6-7 hrs.
Morning Passenger train from Vishakapatnam. Train No. 1VK. Starts at 0645h and reaches Jagdalpur at 1600h. A beautiful stretch. First and Second class reservations available. Make sure you tie up with TTE and packed lunch ordered en route.
Read full review 





LAND OF CAVES AND FALLS
Post by Janavi | Chennai | Dec 12, 2012
Can go only by train. Dont miss the tunnels engraved in between the easter n coastal railway.but be careful with the copassengers in the train and vendors.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Konark





Poetry in Stone
Post by Dipendra | Guwahati | Mar 14, 2007
It takes just about an hour or so from the capital of Orissa by road and the road condition is good. On the way one can take a break at PIPLI, where one gets a chance to satisfy one's hearts desire one seeing and buying a spectrum of APPLIQUE WORK, which involves cutting of colourful fabrics in the shape of flowers, birds and animals and then stitching them artistically on coloured cloths. The most sought after items are Colourful canopies and Garden Umbrellas.
Read full review 





Awe-inspiring architecture or Verses written in stone ?
Post by HimanshuG | Delhi | Jun 15, 2010
Konark is around one and half hour drive away from the well-connected capital of Orissa - Bhubaneswar, through good smooth roads along the very green and welcoming Orissa hinterland and villages.
On the way, the Ashokan rock edict and the Shanti Stupa at Dhauli can be visited, where emperor Ashoka renounced violence and wars after the battle of Kalinga. The view from the stupa of the area around it is simply breathtaking and marvelous.
On the way, further down to Konark, a short break can be taken at the Pipli village, for having a look/shopping for the various handicrafts, and items made using Appliqu work(patch work in bright colors), for which Pipli famous.
Apart from that, the best place to stay in Konark is the Panthnivas Yatri Niwas, which can allow one to visit Konark at sunrise time :)
Read full review 


Read more reviews 
Konark hotels travelers are looking right now




Guesthouses




Panthanivas Yatrinivas








SHOW PRICES





Resorts




Lotus Resort, Ramchandi Beach






6 Reviews


SHOW PRICES

Travelling Tips to Puri





The soul of the soul of India
Post by Dipendra | Guwahati | Jan 15, 2007
Bhubaneswar ,the capital of Orissa, is just about two hours drive from Puri , the railroad taking about half an hour less. Bhubaneswar is well connected by the railroad as well by air to all the state capitals of india as well as to the national capital of Delhi. Since the call of the sea is irresistible here ,it is best to stay in a hotel near the sea beach so as to facilitate a fast bath in fresh water after a session in the saline waters .
Read full review 





PURI- In my eyes
Post by Purna
Take a train from Bhubneswar . Its just one and half an hour journey . If you are coming form far then it is better to take a train from your city or any bigger city nearer to your place . Like If are from Assam then its better to take a train from Guwahati or else you can come down to Kolkata and can change the train. 
Read full review 





Ever interesting destination
Post by Santa | Kolkata | Jun 10, 2011
Best time - Winter. If you are adventures, then visit in Moonsoon. It is well connected by Train from all over India. Nearest Airport - Bhubaneswar (around 55 km away).
Beware of - Hotel pimps,hired car driver. Like other pilgrims not to flash moneys.
Non-Hindus are not allowed inside the Temple.
It's impossible to describe Puri in few word. In fact it needs a book to write about Puri.
JAI JAGANNATH !
Read full review 







Land of Sri Jagannath
Post by Sumit | Kolkata | Apr 30, 2011
Puri is well connected by train from Howrah. All the major South bound trains hals at Bhubaneshwar, the nearest junction and airport ( around 70 kms). Being the state capital, Bhubaneshwar is also connected by train from New Delhi and Chennai. Flight frequencies, although, are not that much.
Read full review 





Jagannath Puri Dham Darshan
Post by AKL | Delhi | Jan 11, 2011
Puri to Konark and back (2 hrs travel to-fro, 2-3 hrs at konark, 1 hr at Chandrabhaga beach, 15 min at Ramchandi temple) - Tavera (Rs 900/-), Sumo (Rs 800), Indica (Rs 500/-) , Tata Magic - Rs 600/-) - Negotiate in advance for time and duration else you wd feel short of time and in hurry
Puri to chilka and back (abt 3.5 hrs travel to-fro, 3- 5 hrs at chilka) - Tavera (Rs 1200/-), Sumo (Rs 1000), Indica (Rs 700/-) , Tata Magic - Rs 800/-) - Negotiate in advance for time and duration else you wd feel short of time and in hurry..boat capacity is actually 10-12 people as per boatman..but agents/owners insist on 6 person...negotiate in advance lse you wd feel cheated (price per boat based on trip/duration is Rs 1600/- to Rs 2200/-...IT IS NEGOTIABLE....please bargain (4-5 hrs at chilka)
It gets (Satpada) as dark quite early so plan to leave early in day. you will not be able to see dolphins if you do not go upto Nalabanda (you may tip your boatman!)
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Balasore



bhraman

Travelling Tips to Baripada



When I Fell in Love with Simlipal
Post by Sanjay | Delhi | Nov 20, 2008
How to reach
Simlipal is well connected by road, rail and air. Baripada--located only 17 km away from Simlipal--is the nearest rail head. The City of Joy Kolkata is 240 km away and the state capital of Bhubaneshwar is just 270 km away from Simlipal.
When to visit
The Simlipal National Park remains open for the visitors from November to June. I visited the wonderful national park during the month of January and much enjoyed my visit.
Read full review 





Beauty of Jungle
Post by Saswati | Kolkata | May 30, 2012
You can get direct bus from Kolkata to Baripada. Otherwise you can go to Baleswar by train from Howrah, then auto & bus service is available to reach Baripada.
Read full review 







Super place
Post by Sabyasachi
Nearest city is Bhubaneswar & Kokata. There are Always bus communication in every one hour from Bhubaneswar the capital of orissa to Baripada about 250 kilometer. A express train departure time is 5.45pm at Bhubaneswar & arrival time at Baripada is 10.15 pm except Saturday.
There are 5 nos of buses comes regularly from Kolkata to Baripada abot 200 kilometer . A express train Departure time at Shalimar 6am arrival time at Baripada 12 noon.
Best suitable time is for visit Similipal national park is from October to February. 
Read full review 







The photographs are famous places of Baripada
Post by Sabyasachi
Direct train from (Shalimar) Kolkata and from Bhubaneswar available to Baripada via Rupsa. There are always bus communication available from Kolkata and Bhubaneswar.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Berhampur





Berhampur
Post by Debanjan | Kolkata | Dec 18, 2012
By air - The nearest airport is at Bhubaneswar, 180 km from Gopalpur-on-sea. Bhubaneshwar is a one-hour flight from Kolkata.
By rail - The nearest railhead is Berhampur (16 km from Gopalpur-on-sea ) on the Kolkata-Chennai line. Berhampur is 608 km from Howrah and 1069 km from 
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Jalpaiguri





Green Paradise : forests in the Dooars region
Post by Ananda | Kolkata | Jun 25, 2006
Arriving at Bagdogra airport or New Jalpaiguri station hire a SUV and move on. The car rentals are quite steep. In the monsoons be prepared to face leeches; they drop down from overhanging branches
Read full review 


Read more reviews 
Jalpaiguri hotels travelers are looking right now




Resorts




Sinclairs Retreat, Dooars






9 Reviews

Travelling Tips to Santiniketan



Our trip to Vishwabharti Shantiniketan
Post by Shoma | Kolkata | Apr 28, 2012
There are dozens of wonderful trains that take you from Howrah in Kolkata directly to Santiniketan in ac chair cars or non-ac compartments. It takes around two and a half hours and these trains like Viswabharati Express generally stick to the timings and are not delayed.
If one wants to attend either of the two festivals - the Spring Festival at Holi or the Poush Festival in end-December, one would have to book a hotel at least a year in advance because every single room is filled much in advance. But the rates are doubled during festive time. The languages spoken are Bengali, Hindi and English and some dialectical Bengali. Food is mainly non-vegetarian but one can get dosas and idlis if one wishes to partake of veg fare. For spring, one thin warm sweater would do but for Poush Festival, one needs to carry very heavy woolens.
Read full review 





A Place I would like to come again
Post by Harish | Delhi | Mar 26, 2011
Santiniketan is well connected by Rail & Road. There are many trains available from Sealdah & Howrah. Journey time is just 2 and a half hours. By road journey also takes almost the same time.
Read full review 





Shyor Bithi Culture Park, Taltore
Post by Ronit | Allahabad | Nov 20, 2010
The park located within 15 minutes of walking distance from Prantik Station, can also be reached by car (convenient car parking space is available) or by cycle rickshaw which are available in plenty.
Read full review 





A Memorable Trip to Shantiniketan
Post by Rittika  | Kolkata | Dec 19, 2012
You can reach via train which is available from Howrah. It takes about 3 hours. A/C compartment available. It is better to visit this place during the winters.
Read full review 





Far away from the madding crowd
Post by Tutul | Kolkata | Oct 31, 2011
Tourists from outside Bengal should come to Kolkata and take the Santiniketan Exp, which runs all 7 days. Starts at 10:10 am from Howrah and reaches santiniketan at 12:30 pm. While returning the same train starts at 1:10 pm and reaches Howrah at 3:30 pm. There are a number of other long distance train that runs via santiniketan, hence one can choose any of these trains too.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Murshidabad



A travel back in history
Post by Deeptendu | Kolkata | Jan 1, 2013
From Kolkata, take the Hazarduari Express.
Stay in Hotel Manjusha by the Ganges.
WARNING: Hotel Manjusha is the only hotel in Murshidabad where you can spend your time watch the Ganges flow idly by from your hotel verandah. Opt for rooms 201 to 204 if you can. The hotel is usually booked in advance on weekends, so plan ahead.
Read full review 





Tour To Murshidabad
Post by Mohini
Hotel Stuff Gives us many Tips which help us through out our travels,like must burgen before hire a tanga,Hotel stuff gives a tour plan which help us .
Must visit Murshidabad In winter Season.
Read full review 





Trip to hazarduari
Post by Anupam | Kolkata | Jan 24, 2013
Well connected via railway, road from kolkata
there are trains like bhagirathi exp, lalgola fast psngr etc...
there are buses by sbstc, just check at their booking offices and many private bus services apart from private vehicles at hire.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Cooch-Behar



Experience Chalsa In Dooars Dist. West Bengal
Post by Poly | Thane | Nov 9, 2009
How to Travel:
If by train, get down at NJP [New JalPaiguri] and take a maruti Van [charges Rs.750/- - 800/-] which will drop you to your destination at Chalsa..
Local sight seeing may cost anywhere between Rs. 1200/- Rs.1500/- per day..
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Asansol



OUR TRIP TO ASANSOL 
Post by Biswajit | Kolkata | Nov 2, 2012
The Asansol City is nice enough that any can enjoy and will have a good experience to stay here.
However should have to be aware the bus routs and time-tables and you could not enjoy the evening till late nite.
It is well conneted with bus routs with NH-2 and RAIL routs with Easter Railways (Howrah-Delhi Routs).
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Daman





Refreshing Daman
Post by Pavan
Vapi is the mail railway station on western railway,
Vapi to Nani Daman Taxi Stand Rs.20/- by Taxi & for Full Taxi Rs.120/- Don't go by rickshaw as they not allowed in Daman.
Carry simple & light clothes
Read full review 





Delightful Daman ! ! !
Post by Neville | Baroda | Jan 20, 2011
By Rail - Nearest station is Vapi. Take a rickshaw, bus or a taxi from Vapi to Daman.
By road - 3 hours drive from Mumbai (nearest Airport)
WARNING - beware while carrying out liqour from Daman as it is bordered by Gujarat which is a dry state.
Read full review 





Daman-Not Much to See
Post by Rajesh | Mumbai | May 27, 2011
Good connectivity via Roads as well as Rail, nearest train station is Vapi.
NH8 from Mumbai we need to take left at Vapi.
In few months time, the roads would be even wider as construction work is in progress at various places
Read full review 





Relaxing trip to Daman 
Post by Hardik | Ahmedabad | Jan 25, 2013
Book your hotels well in prior and if you are going to bath in Jampore beach then be ready to take a VERY COLD FRESH WATER shower. The fresh water of the shower IS EXTREMELY ICE COLD. You even might get headache. 
Read full review 





sea beach
Post by Rohan | Kolkata | Nov 26, 2012
Easily accessible from Mumbai, Surat, etc. Nearest railway station is Vapi. Hotels have pickup & drop fecility. Public transport is also available from Vapi station. 
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Diu



The lovely beach experience
Post by Shalini  | Ahmedabad | Mar 4, 2013
Visit in the month of Nov - Jan to experience mild winters of the sea cost...
Go by train - Nearest station is Veraval , 5kms is Somnath temple which you can see while going Diu...
Diu has an airport too.
Tips: Carry a pair of sunglasses ,hat & sunscreen
Read full review 





A Calm and serene place to relax
Post by Nitin | Baroda | Jan 30, 2011
Diu has the airport. Can check the connectivity from your starting point.
Somanth/Verawal is the major railway station having good connectivity with Ahmedabad, Baroda and other major cities across states.
From Somanth/Verwal Diu can be reached by road vide private Taxis, Coaches, State transport bus.
Read full review 





Diu is the fantastic place to visit. siteseeing are very good
Post by N k 
By taxi from somnath is good option because buses are not good. Flight is another option. On 31st Dec. hotels are very costly and too much crowed on the roads.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Anjuna Beach



World famous Beach with a unique History
Post by Rajiv
Because of its pleasant climate, Anjuna can be visited at any time of the year. However, tourists should beware the heavy rainfall between June and October. November to February is the best time to visit Anjuna.
Read full review 





Anjuna Beach: North Goa's paradise!
Post by Saurav
If you are planning to reach Anjuna directly:
By Train:
Nearest rail-head: Thivim Station (direct buses to Mapusa and then to Anjuna)
Nearest Airport: Dabolim (taxi would take around Rs 500... approx 25-30kms)
regular bus service from Mumbai, Mangalore, Bangalore, Pune, etc.
Read full review 





Soak up some sun!!!!
Post by Parinita | Bangalore | Jan 11, 2007
You can reach Anjuna, by flight, air as well as bus. The airport is about a 1 and a half hour drive from Anjuna.
Carry your sun block and soak up some sun!
Read full review 





Goa vacation with friends
Post by Sundeep | Bangalore | Dec 26, 2012
Goa is well connected by road/rail/air so it should not be a problem to get there, the resort is very close to the Anjuna beach so it should not be a problem to locate it.
Directions : Take the road to Anjuna from Calangute/Baga, At a circle just before the beach take the right that goes towards Vagator. On the left you will spot a super market, take the immediate left after this market and you reach the resort.
Warnings : Avoid the monsoons for this kind of a vacation and thats it! 
Read full review 





Feel like a Goan there!
Post by Ganeshkumar | Chennai | Dec 6, 2012
Don't travel on 2nd October, since it was Gandhi day you won't even get a beer. Because once i landed on the same day and gone dry. But fortunately Dry-day over by night 10PM.
Otherwise warning: If i happened to be there be cautious girls! :)
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Baga



The truth about Baga
Post by Evaluator
All watersports. However do not expect to find the international fibre glass speed boats in Goa. You will get jet ski, para sailing etc etc... but remember Goa beaches do not have a coral reef, therefore there is no lagoon and water depth may change from shallow to 20 ft or more suddenly.
Railhead from anywhere, try to stop at Thivim, its closer to Baga. Always book prepaid taxis at the exit of the railway station, safer and less rip off. Do not try the motorbike taxis!
Airport in dabolim.
By road, NH17 from Mangalore or Pune
Read full review 







Go Go Goa!
Post by Udaibir | Bangalore | Mar 5, 2011
Goa is very tourist friendly and safe. One can get to Goa via, train, bus or air. remember the best time to be in Goa is from October end to late February. The rates are also higher during the peak season.
The Xmas and New Year carnival is not to be missed at all.
Read full review 





The perfect place to party
Post by Karan
Centrally located and one can easily walk around baga. Best ride will always be bikes and scooty available easily on rent for self drive. safe place to part till early morning. 
Read full review 





Xmas & New Year 2010/2011
Post by Maria | Panjim | Jun 7, 2011
Easy to reach - beware of the huge potholes in the 'pavements' when walking around at night. Sea very rough at Baga beach at certain times. There are lifeguards now - take notice!!
Read full review 





Gooaaaa
Post by Shravani | Hyderabad | Feb 13, 2013
If traveling in summer, carry only very light clothing as it will be extremely humid. Lots and lots and lots of waterproof sunscreen.
If traveling in the monsoon dont forget your waterproofing gear. You still need sunscreen.
always wear light clothes while going to play in the beach. jeans tends to be heavy when wet :)

Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Calangute





Home to the tourists
Post by Shagun | Nagpur | Apr 19, 2011
Calangute is well connected to all of Goa. If its your 1st trip to Goa, make sure you stay around here, you will love it.
An answer to everything you would want to do and see on a Goa trip
Read full review 







Calangute- Baga Beach - Goa
Post by Surej | Bangalore | Apr 28, 2006
You can travel by train- Bangalore to Vasco but Calangute by Bus via Panjim gets ardous . So travell Sleeper Bus from Bangalore - Panjim then bargain with a taxi for Rs.200 to Calangute. Then shack up in any of the small hotels.
All such places cater to the European needs i.e clean toilet and clean beds and are cheap Rs 250 - 350 per day. A little bit of preference is given by the hotels restaurants staff to the foriegn tourists - so if you do tip as most Indians Dont - then on the second meal you can see the changes.
Calangute is not a safe beach, deep. so use Baga .
Read full review 





Experience in the beach of Goa During Monsoon
Post by Max | Delhi | Jul 28, 2009
By Air:
Goa is well connected with all the major cities in India. Airport is in Vasco.
By Rail:
There are lots of train to Goa from Delhi. Goa Express, Mangla Lakshdweep Exp., Goa Sampark Kranti Exp. and lots more. Major stations are Madgaon, Vasco, and Thivim. Anyone travelling to Calangute beach should stop at Thivim station and hire taxi outside the station to reach Calangute. There is a pre-paid booth outside the station where you need to pay approx. Rs. 350 to reach Calangute.
Goa is the god of all destinations and anyone can visit anytime in Goa but I would still suggest that Goa is best avoided during the monsoons.
Read full review 





full of activities
Post by Anita | Delhi | Mar 13, 2007
Depends where you stay, like from delhi, taking direct flight is the best, but if you have time and budget then you can go in GOA express too. from bombay so many flights are available ...
Read full review 





Calangute Goa
Post by Prashant | Gurgaon | Dec 18, 2012
Plan it and do the research on the net, after that search for good deal from a good travel site like Holiday IQ and book it and enjoy the trip without any worries.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Candolim Beach



Candolim Capers
Post by Ken
Driving standards are very different from those in Europe and will be frightening at first but there is some method in all the chaos and you soon get used to it. Taxis are inexpensive and everywhere. I would strongly advise against hiring cars, scooters or bikes - it's just too dangerous.
Goans are open, friendly people and it's impossible to leave without having made some special friends and lasting memories.
Read full review 







Candolim Beach holiday in March
Post by Ravikiran | Pune | Dec 15, 2011
If you happen to take a flight to Goa, Candolim is appx. 30 Km drive from Dabolim airport.It has a good road connectivity from Mumbai and Pune if you love to drive. Margoa railway junction is well connected to most rail routs. If you happen to travel in sunny months like I did, do carry enough summer clothing as you may not get a chance to use local laundry service or to dry your cloths. Its better to carry enough shorts, light three fourth trousers and lots of T- shirts in summer.While visiting the beach do ask for towels from the hotel.You can use Candolim as a central hub to visit nearby Calangut, Baga beaches and other north Goa destinations. 
Read full review 





candolim
Post by Jayne
Your best to stick with one taxi driver as you build up good friendship and get good price for your loyalty but they may want you to go to a jewellery store for 10 mins so they can get free fuel but you dont have to buy
Read full review 





(GOA) Garden of Adam n eve!
Post by Clayten | Mumbai | Dec 12, 2011
We had great fun when we went for sighting seeing in North and south goa. The beautiful beaches, forts and the water sports that this place has to offer.It was quite easy for us to travell too, since the resort had a bus for the same and most important a comfortable drive throughout the day. Yes you do have to abide to the warnings at various heritage places and to certain point on every beach. (After all rules made to be broken), but thats totally wrong we need to follow the instructions and avoid from having any bad experience to come across whenever we are traveling to a place like Goa. 
Read full review 





Candolim Beach-The Experience
Post by Vidhya | Hyderabad | Nov 16, 2012
A taxi will take you there from the airport and may cost you around 500 rupees or more depending on the season. Do NOT go to calungute as it is very crowded and stuffy. Hit the beach as soon as you freshen up. Great place to relax or explore.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Chapora



Dil Chahta Hai!!
Post by Nikhil | Bangalore | May 20, 2006
One will probably have to come here via local bus, hire a vehicle and drive down to the fort.
Make sure you wear your sport shoes while visiting this place, because you will have to climb the hill for about 10 minutes to reach the fort.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Colva





Uncrowded beach
Post by Vaderaj | Bangalore | Feb 18, 2011
Nothing much to be scared of. Just be yourselves and ward off advances of hawkers and bike lenders by not responding to them (if you are not interested in getting one for yourselves). Adhere to coast guards suggestions and warnings and do not take lightly the sea water undercurrents.
Read full review 







colva-made simple
Post by Banani | Delhi | Feb 9, 2011
From the airport take a pre-paid taxi at rs 650. The drivers are all probably wannabe pilots so tell them to keep on the road and leave the airspace to the airlines people. I did not know that these guys could fly a Qualis. Absolutely amazing. The Toyota guys should be proud. Seriously tell them that you are not in a hurry.
Read full review 





Viva La Goa....
Post by Sourav
Do carry a long white towel to cover yourself as the heat and the sun rays will burn your skin. for the ladies, applying sunscreen having atleast SPF-30 is a must. carry shades, long hats. the sea water and the sand are a bit coarse, hence it is advisable to wear a t-shirt while you go inside the water.
From the bus stand or from the railway station, keep in mind that the auto-rickshaw doesn't charge you more than Rs 150. if they do, please negotiate.
Enjoy....
Read full review 





goa trip
Post by Rahul  | Ahmedabad | Jan 8, 2013
Dont rely on the riskshaw or taxi wala's especially in the midnight abt the rent, as their rate's are 4times, so, i think bus facilities are the good option from railway station or from bus stand.
Read full review 





Colva the best of Goa
Post by Swagata | Kolkata | Dec 6, 2012
We missed our train from mumbai, we reached at colva by volvo and we lose one day. so as a warning please don't try to catch a connective train in short time difference.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Dona Paula



Trip for conference at IC, Goa
Post by Tushar  | Delhi | Dec 6, 2012
Rent a Activa/Scooty at Green Palm Tours & Travels (Near Dona Paula PS, opposite NIO) and explore the nearby area. Road to Fort Aguda from Calangute Beach has good high quality shopping and a lot of bars/pubs/restaurants. 
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Majorda Beach



goa
Post by Zakir hussain | Bangalore | Dec 25, 2012
Dont ever take the state highway from hubli to goa going through maulim the roads are in pathetic state.instead take the route via karwar the roads are good and will join NH 47 at karwar this NH runs across goa state.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Anand



Post by Chirag
You get down at Anand Junction which is just 5Km from place.. if you are traveling by Air than it is between Ahmedabad & Vadodara, Can land any of the city and hire a Taxi. Easy reach of 1.5 Hr from Ahm & 1 Hr form Vadodara Airport.

Junagadh
Post by Chandrakant

Travelling Tips to Dholavira



Experience Ancient Civilisation & Bird Watching
Post by Dhiraj | Pune | Nov 21, 2011
(1) Connectivity - You need to have your own vehicle, as there is no local transport available. State Transport Bus is available from Bhuj to Dholavira (Bus stand), but then there is no local transport from Bus stand to Toran resort & excavated site, museum etc.
(2) Resort Booking - Need to book rooms in advance at Gujarat Tourism offices. Online booking facility is not available.
(3) Do carry snacks & water bottles along, as you probably won't find them beyond Rapar (90 Kms. before Dholavira enroute).
(4) There is no other hotel or restaurant in Dholavira i.e. Toran Resort is the only choice.

Read full review 


Read more reviews 
Bus services from Bangalore





Bangalore to Ooty
Bangalore to Pondicherry
Bangalore to Vijayawada
Bangalore to Kochi (Cochin)




Bangalore to Mumbai

Travelling Tips to Bhuj





Real Value for Money
Post by Ashok | Indore | Feb 20, 2011
Bhuj has a railhead and an airport, though we drove from Indore,which made it easier and convenient to extensively cover the whole of Kutch!
One needs prior police permits to visit The Great Rann.
These are easily and quickly made available.
Read full review 





Visit to white desert
Post by Gora
To reach Bhuj from Mumbai there is Mumbai- Bhuj flight. You can come from Mumbai to Bhuj via train also. For Delhi or people from north or east, best way to come to Ahmedabad and then go via rail or road. It is better to go during winter. Summer is quite hot.
Read full review 





Splendid place to explore Kutchh
Post by Mihir | Ahmedabad | Jan 24, 2013
In-spite of being very remote one should not miss visit to Dholaveera.
While going from Ahmedabad you can first visit Dholaveera and reach Bhuj by night if you have started as early as 5.00 in the morning.
You might happen to watch big colonies of Flamingos on the way.
Read full review 





Nice place.
Post by Vineeta 
For people wanting to see Dholavira a sign should be put on the highway for the turning, so that one can visit it before going to Bhuj. We went by road and it was a lovely journey cause the roads are super and we did'nt get lost anywhere.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Gondal



Great Royal experience
Post by Girish | Gandhinagar | Jan 28, 2013
Take a good SUV or heavy car like Toyota Innova if u can as the driving can be a little aggressive in these parts. In summer months always use a air conditioned car.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Ajanta & Ellora





way more than just caves...
Post by Divya | Delhi | May 25, 2006
Its best to take a maharashtra state tourist bus from aurangabad or other towns from where they operate, especially if u're travelling alone. Summer time dont forget to carry a hat and water bottle. hats are available there, but expensive. do buy one if u forget to take along because the heat is killing. keep sipping water as you walk.
Read full review 







Amazing Ajanta and Excellent Ellora
Post by Amitra | Thane | Feb 6, 2013
Have powerful torch as the caves are quite dark inside. Photography with flash/ tripod is not allowed. Avoid shoes with lace for frequent on and off. Cover Ajanta during first half as the caves are east facing. Have sufficient water and food at the parking bay of Ajanta as nothing is available at the cave upstairs. Be aware of honey bee caves around as at times they get annoyed.
Aurangabad is well connected with the rest of the country in all three ways  Air, Rail and Road and you could search on internet that suits your needs. We travelled from Mumbai and found the following is the best option.
17057 Devagiri Express Daily Mumbai (CSTM) 21.05 Aurangabad (AWB) 04.05, 12 stops, 7 hours, 274km, 3AC  Rs.503. 17618 Tapovan Express Daily AWB 14.35 CSTM 22.05, 12 stops, 7 hour 30 minutes, CC  Rs.403

Read full review 





Ellora caves only.
Post by Feline | Bangalore | Nov 9, 2010
One thing to note is Ajanta caves face the east so visit them in the first half of the day as there is no lights inside. Ellora caves face the west so visit them in the second half of the day. Also make sure on which day the Cave is closed. One day of the week the caves will be closed. Preferable to keep a torch with you when you visit the caves. Some places are dark as there is no electricity in there. Note : Covering Ajanta and Ellora caves in one day is very very difficult considering the distance and walking to do. Best is schedule 3 days for A'bad. 1st day Ellora / Ajanta, 2nd day other spots in A'bad so you get some rest, 3rd day Ajanta / Ellora. This would be ideal.
Read full review 





Ajanta & Ellora: No frills trip (only caves)
Post by Shubham | Mumbai | Apr 20, 2009
Note that Ajanta is about 1 hour from Jalgaon while Ellora is about 45 mins from Aurangabad. Ajanta and Ellora are about 2 hours apart. so, if you are dependent on a train, then you might want to see things in the order Jalgaon-Ajanta-Ellora-Aurangabad, or vice versa.
Also note that if you are going there from Mumbai, then the frequency of trains is more for Jalgaon than from Auarangabad.
wht i did was, i went from mumbai to jalgaon, reached there at 6.30 am after an overnight (6.5 hr) train journey.From Jalgaon railway station i took a rickshaw to the state transport bus stand. It was a 1 hour drive from Jalgaon bus stand to Fardapur, when u get off the bus in Fardapur, there is an MTDC resort bang opposite the road. We checked in there and freshened up. Ajanta caves is 5 mins rickshaw ride, rs. 40 for an entire rickshaw you hire, from the resort.Ajanta opens at 9 am. So we reached ajanta by 9.30 am. Went throught the caves in detail. We were done by about 12.30. Eating at the ajanta cafeteria was a better idea than in the MTDC resort, because the restaurant in MTDC reort had very few options.
We relaxed in the resort for the rest of the day, next morning we checked out, had a two hour cab drive worth Rs. 1350 ( both ways to and fro ellora), to Ellora, reached there around noon. Went about till 3 pm, and returned in the same cab all the way to Fardapur and then took the state transport bus to Jalgaon to catch my train. The mistake I made was, I shouldnt have returned to Jalgaon, should have gone to aurangabad from ELlora , and caught a train from there. It would have saved me a lot of fatigue!
Tips:
Try to go to the caves in the morning time. It saves you from heat, and also the crowd, as the day passes, there tend to be more people in the caves, from around aurangabad ( the locals), and that makes things a little irritating!
In ajanta, dont take a full guide for all caves, the more imp caves have care-takers who will tell you the basic stuff, and you can tip them accordingly. If you make use of them you will end up paying not more than Rs. 150/- for the entire set of Ajanta caves. ( Keep tenners handy to pay them).
Read full review 





Felt like a Boddhist Monk
Post by Saurabh
-Ellora caves are closed on mondays and Ajanta caves are closed on Tuesday, that makes it a truly weekend destination.
-Try to start early in the morning so that you get more time in the caves as closing time is about 6 PM.
-Stay at Aurangabad as Ajanta and Ellora are very well connected to the city, and in addition you can enjoy places in Aurangabad like Daulatabad Fort, Bibi ka Makbara (Mini Tajmahal), Paithan Garden, Panchakki etc.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Chandrapur



Chandrapur in one hour
Post by P | Mumbai | Jun 19, 2011
The auto fellows fleece the visitors as in every city but here they are a bit farfetched. A trip round the corner will cost rs50/-
There are no direct Bom-Chandrapur buses. Make sure you have a confirmed seat in the railways.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Elephanta Caves



Not a great trip!!
Post by Chintu | Mumbai | May 12, 2009
Please make sure you don't travel during the monsoons because the sea gets rough and the ferry services are discontinued till monsoon gets over..However some of the ferry operators ignore the rule and run the ferry which is very dangerous..
Don't fall for the old ladies who offer to get their pictures clicked..they start asking you for money once its done..
Look out for the locals who I feel are waiting for an opportunity to rip off visitors...
Dont mess with the monkeys...
If you are the nature types and wary enough you could have a good time with your friends family etc..
Read full review 







Visit to the World heritage Elephanta caves
Post by VRV | Mumbai | Aug 20, 2008
Catch a ferry early so you get good time to see and explore the beauty of the island.The last ferry on return is at 5:30 pm.There are no facilities for overnight stay-though there are a number of good restaurants for lunch / snacks.
Read full review 





So near.....but yet too far.
Post by Ankur | Mumbai | Dec 8, 2011
You can reach Church gate station and from there you can wither walk or take a taxi to Gate Way of India. From Gate Way of India there are ferries who take you to Elephanta caves.Its almost a 40 mins travel in the ferry. Once you get down from the ferry you need to walk from the Jetty and follow the road....It will tak you to the Caves. There is a small fee for the entry to the caves. 
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Sangli



To Visit Sangli Ganesh Temple
Post by Yogesh  | Pune | Jan 15, 2013
Car is a better option to reach Sangli. It is approximately 225 kms from Pune. The interior roads are quite good though lot of pot holes make your journey a little tiring.

Travelling Tips to Bordi



Beautiful beach
Post by Jayesh | Mumbai | Jan 1, 2012
When you search for MTDC Bordi in Google map, you will see two such place. Select MTDC resort and not MTDC tent for direction as the later is wrongly put on the map. Drive is pleasant with some bad patch and crowded Dhanu market. Enjoy driving on the Dahanu beach road.
Read full review 







The land of chikkus
Post by Priya | Mumbai | Jul 16, 2010
You can either take the flying rani train from bombay central, borivali which reaches dahanu road within 1.5 hours or take a shuttle from Virar to Gholwad station (stn next to dahanu). The resort is just 3km from Gholwad. From Dahanu, the rickshaw charges upto rs 300 to reach bordi.
Read full review 







Dahanu, Bordi, Jawhar excursion
Post by Vishwajeet | Pune | May 15, 2009
From pune you can go to Thane and from Ghodbundar Road to Borivili. From Borivili western express highway towards Dahanu.
Best time to visit is winter. However you can enjoy summer holidays too.

Read full review 





Bordi...be aware
Post by Rahul | Mumbai | Sep 15, 2008
Take gujarat express early in the morning and reach dahanu. Otherwise, you can take a Virar local and from Virar you get a passenger train every 1-2 hours. You can also get down at Gholvad station, check out the trains which stops there. You can take a rick from both places. We came back from Gholvad waking up early in morning and came by Valsad passenger at 6.00 am. We were at dadar by 9.
Read full review 





Best chaat in Thane
Post by Benu | Mumbai | Jul 21, 2006
About 100 kms from Mumbai you can drive up as well as take a train on the Western Railway to Gholvad which is the station that you have to reach and is also suitable for a day trip
Read full review 


Read more reviews
