Best way to travel from Bangalore to Mahabalipuram
Mahabalipuram is located at a distance of about 346 km from Bangalore. The town is famous for its temples and is well-connected to Bangalore by roadways and railways. However, the best way to reach Mahabalipuram from Bangalore is by road, a journey of about 6 hours. The places covered during the journey from Bangalore to Mahabalipuram are Bangalore - 54 km -> Kamandoddi - 14 km -> Chinnar - 24 km -> Krishnagiri - 115 km -> Pogai - 8km -> Konavattam - 136km -> Poonjeri - 2km -> Mahabalipuram. On the way to Mahabalipuram, there are several petrol pumps and ATMs at regular intervals. Besides, dhabas and hotels like A2B and others are also situated on the route. 

Transport options from Bangalore to Mahabalipuram
Bangalore to Mahabalipuram By Bus: Take a bus from Bangalore to Mahabalipuram that takes around 7 hours. The bus stand at Mahabalipuram is situated at a distance of about 2 km from the city centre. Economical and ideal for individual travellers or group travel. 

Travelling Tips to Mahabalipuram





Trip to 'Coastal Couple' - II
Post by Abbey | Ghaziabad | May 13, 2007
We went from Pondicherry to Mahabalipuram via Bus. There are buses operated by Tamil Nadu govt plying to Chennai. Take the bus which goes through East Coast road. We hired a taxi to drop at Chennai station to catch shatabdi to Bangalore. So two ways to visit the Coastal Couple from Delhi
1. Delhi - Bangalore(Only when You want to visit Bangalore or have friend working there whom you wanna meet) - Take Luxury bus to Pondicherry - hire taxi or Govt bus to Mahabalipuram (will take 2 Hrs approx) - Chennai (2 hours again) - Train or Bus to Bangalore - and WAPAS Delhi
2. Delhi - Chennai - Pondicherry - Mahabalipuram (any of the two can be visited first since Mahabalipuram falls between Chennai and Pondy)  Wapas- Chennai and then Delhi
Read full review 







A city of Heritage & Stone cutters
Post by Sshrinjoy
Buses are available from Chennai & other parts of the state. Conducted tours are provided by Dept. of Tourism, Tamilnadu. Local tour operators also can provide a day tour with luxury private cars to visit all the places. Train services are also available, keep collect some prior information before planning your journey through Train.
Read full review 





Nice Sea shore holiday destination mixed with history education to kids
Post by Akula | Hyderabad | Feb 6, 2011
You could reach here with a 40 to 60 minute cab drive from Chennai Railway station / Airport. Sun cream, sun glasses and a well covering hat are a must. Mentally prepared for a long walk to have the best experience!
Read full review 





Week-end Getaway to Mahabalipuram
Post by Madhu | Chennai | Dec 31, 2010
There are lots of buses from Chennai. TTDC has guided tour from Chennai. We being Chennai residents, just drove on our own. The journey itself is an experience-the ECR (East Coast Road) stretches by the sea-side lined with casurinas..and the road is good too.
Read full review 





Mahabalipuram - Hot, Sweaty but Sublime Carvings on the Sea Shore
Post by Sudeep | Bangalore | Oct 25, 2010
We drove down from Bangalore. Good Road. Down the NH7 to Krishnagiri, turn left onto NH47 and then to Sriperumbudur. Turn right onto a very good Tambaram Bye-pass (Toll road) and come out at Vendulur Zoo. Turn left there and keep going till the end of the road which is the ECR, where one turns right and goes straight till Mahabs.
Read full review

Bangalore to Thanjavur on






Calendar







No buses found on 2013-05-07

Best way to travel from Bangalore to Thanjavur
The distance between Bangalore and Thanjavur is almost 300 km and it takes around seven and a half hours to reach Thanjavur from Bangalore, by car. The road condition is bad and in some places and it gets difficult to drive. The best way to reach Thanjavur, is by rail. The Mailaduturai Express leaves Bangalore Cantonment Station every day at 19:00 hours and reaches Thanjavur early in the morning at 04:48 hours. The fare for the sleeper class, is Rs. 210.

Transport options from Bangalore to Thanjavur
Bangalore to Thanjavur By Bus: Take a direct bus from Bangalore to Thanjavur that takes around 8 hours. Old Bus Stand of Thanjavur is located at the city centre. Suitable option for individual travellers and backpackers. 

Travelling Tips to Thanjavur



The Big Temple.
Post by Feline | Bangalore | Jan 18, 2011
Since it is in the heart of the city, a rickshaw ride should cost you Rs 40/50. If you are travelling in your private vehicle, no problem. After temple, again you will have to travel 2 km to see the Palace, Sarswati Library (which has old maps and palm leaves - naadi shastra was written) and a museum which has beautiful bronze and other material sculptures. Some entrance fees are charged at the entrance of the palace but no entrance fees to see the temple.
Read full review 







Temple tour
Post by Vinod | Chennai | Apr 10, 2013
By road from Chennai via Pondy it is a great experience. Thanjavur being the rice bowl of TN, you can see a lot of paddy fields. It is five hours from Pondicherry by car and one can stop at Kumbakonam, the land of a 1000 temples, en route. There is a small stretch on the grand anicut dam which is narrow and traffic gets delayed.
Read full review 





Thanjavur - Heritage center of Tamil Nadu
Post by S ramachandran | Chennai | Jan 25, 2013
Thanjavur is well connected by rail and road. Lots of nearby tourist places like Kumbakonam, Thiruvyar, Mayiladudurai, Navagraha tempels are situated within a radius of 40 km..
Read full review 





Brihadeeswara Temple
Post by Krithika | Chennai | Jan 22, 2013
We took the bus from our hotel. Autos are also available, though need to bargain a bit. And best to visit in the evening, else walking on the courtyard in the blazing sun can take away the will to enjoy.
Read full review 





ABOUT THANJAVUR
Post by Balu | Chennai | Dec 10, 2012
Those coming from North can travel from Chennai Egmore to Tanjure by train. They also can travel upto Ariyalur if no through train is available and there after they can get into bus.
Read full review

Buses From Bangalore to Trichy

Select bus 
Seat selection 
Passanger Info 
Payment 
Confirmation


Bangalore to Trichy on






Calendar







No buses found on 2013-05-07

Best way to travel from Bangalore to Trichy
The distance between Bangalore and Trichy is almost 370 km. It takes six hours, by road. The best way to reach Trichy from Bangalore, is to take a bus till Salem, which will go through Hosur and then, change another bus for Bangalore, which will go through Namakkal. There are direct buses from Bangalore to Trichy, but frequencies are very less and also not regular. So, the best way, is to change buses at Salem, where one can find plenty of buses going to Trichy.

Transport options from Bangalore to Trichy
Bangalore to Trichy By Bus: Take a bus from Bangalore to Salem that takes over 3 hours. From Salem, take another bus to Trichy, which takes around 2 hours. Trichy bus stand is about 8 km away from the city centre and can be reached by an auto-rickshaw. Direct buses from Bangalore to Trichy are also available, but not at regular intervals. Ideal for individual travellers, backpackers and youngsters. 

Travelling Tips to Trichy



Trichy - looking ahead
Post by S. anandan | Chennai | Nov 24, 2011
Some tips that i follow:
-dress very casually, usually in cotton clothing's.
-do not hassle with the 'auto' drivers, most of the time they are very polite.
-do not over eat or eat a lot of spicy foods through out the day.
-if you can speak Tamil, it is definitely an extra advantage, even tough English is perfectly alright.

Read full review 





HOTEL TAMILNADU, TRICHIRAPPALLI
Post by Pattabiraman | Chennai | Dec 28, 2012
it is center place in tamilnadu and can be reached by air, rail and by road as well. trichy is a good place to visit and stay for few days for all types of tourists.
Read full review 





Srirangam Ranganathaswamy Temple
Post by Florien | Mumbai | Feb 5, 2009
Bus, auto, taxi from Trichy. Travel time - 15 min from Trichy. Basic accommodation available at Srirangam and plenty of choice at Trichy. Trichy has an airport and is a major rail head.
Read full review 





Trichy-an twin capital of Tamil Nadu
Post by Sqn ldr g ramani | Tiruchirapalli | Mar 28, 2007
Trichy is well connected by Air, Bus, and Rail from Chennai; so also Trichy is well connected by Bangalore and Trivandrum, the neighbouring state capitals.
It will be better if you surrender your valuables to Bell-captain of hotel and carry credit cards.

Read full review 





our trip to trichy
Post by Ravisankar
Take a good advice from your hotel regarding taxis and good drivers as it could make a lot of difference. be prepared to be fleeced in spite of all your precautions. otherwise you will not be able to enjoy.
Read full review

THE SALT TOWN
Post by mssthirdeye | Bangalore | Mar 21, 2013
CAN BE REACHED BY AIR (airport 16kms) but do arrange for pick up beforehand,
Tuticorin is on the seaside and hence will be really hot anytime of the year.

Travelling Tips to Hosur



Anchetti
Post by Nagabhushan | Bangalore | Oct 7, 2008
We rode on for a couple of kilometers more before abandoning our plans to look for a tea shack. Sat down by a compost heap and took a few sepia-toned photographs with the mobile. Started back and halted midway on the climb, though we had read caution notices that passengers should not alight at these places. We reasoned that it made more sense during nights, especially when the vegetation was lush and water was plenty, which draw out the elephants from their daytime retreat.
Then we heard the sound of water flowing, spotted the muddy brown stream gushing amongst boulders way below, noticed there were some young fellas who had probably been swimming somewhere nearby. It was a typically non-threatening stretch of forest with the winding road acting like a lifeline! Only when you spend enough time off the road do you appreciate the existence of a road however humble!!
Then we continued up to the outskirts of Denkanikota, stopped for some grub as we felt ravenously hungry, proceeded to Sudhir's ancestral home which I was visiting after many, many years. There was absolutely no disrepair as I feared - in fact, it had been improved in patches and was absolutely comfortable as we stepped in from the sun. We gobbled up some jackfruit that grew in the backyard, chit-chatted some more and hit the road again.
This time we managed to take the road towards TVS Motors and then linked up to NH4. Our journey home was halted briefly as the rain lashed out, and, more hot food awaited us when we reached home. We did not ask for anything else!! The romance with Anchetti had concluded, promising to resurface on some unsuspecting rainy day!
One thing however had changed: Anchetti was no longer just a name, a destination or a possibility - it had entered the long list of places that have suffered a visit by us!! Long live Anchetti!
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Tawang



Exotic Arunachal
Post by Santanu
We were aided in our tour plan by sites like www.indiamike.com, www.holidayiq.com, tawang.nic.in, arunachalpradesh.nic.in and Himalayan holidays etc. Furthermore, the District Tourism Officer at Bomdilla Mr. Riggio also helped us plan our conveyance. We contacted the Managing Director of Himalayan Holidays Mr. Tsering Wange who also helped us plan the tour and he provided us with the conveyance, a Tata Victa driven by Mr. Samar Das an young, confident and safe driver.
The Tourist Lodge at Bomdilla (Rooms ranging from Rs. 400  Rs. 600) cannot be booked from before, but generally rooms are available. In case it is booked there is yet another Guest House, the Doe-Gu-Khil Guest House near Gaden Rabgye Ling Monastery better known as the upper Gompa, which is very good though a bit costlier Tourist Lodge at Tawang. There are also Tourist Lodges at Dirang and Bhalukpong).
Besides, we also contacted other authorized tour operators Mr. Abhijeet and Mr. Trideep.

Read full review 







Fairy Land of Northeast
Post by Saroj madhusudan | Delhi | Jul 24, 2011
We started early (6:30 AM) from Guwahati on 18th March 2011. Had lunch at Bhalukpong (12:30 PM) and reached Bomdilla at 04:30 PM. Night halt was at Bomdilla ( Govt. Tourist Rest House).Started next day (06:30 AM on 19th March) to Tawang. Had breakfast enroute at Dirang (2 hrs drive). Site seeing on the way ... Nyukmadung War Memorial, Sela Pass, Jaswantgarh War Memorial, Madhuri Falls. Had snacks at Jaswantgarh military canteen. Reached Tawang at 05:00 PM. Night halt at Govt. Tourist Lodge in Tawang. On 20th March local site seeing. started back to Bomdilla on 21st March (visited monastries at Dirang & Bomdilla - You should not miss the Upper Gompa at Bomdilla). On 22nd Mar 11 Started early morning (06:30 AM) to Guwahat and reached Guwahati at 4:30 PM.
Though the strech can be done with small size car, SUV with 4 wheel drive is recommended. If self driving one should be extra careful between Balukpong and Bomdilla where one may encounter dense fog and cloud. Here you can experience driving through clouds. The weather at Sela pass is chilling. So before you step out at Sela Pass wear adequate Warm clothing with woollen cap or muffler. Our hired SUV (Innova) got stuck in the snow on the way back to Guwahati. Army Personnels are there to help keep the pass open for traffic and extend help to every body. Even we helped one Maruti 800 which got stuck in snow.
So it is advisable to cross Sela pass before noon & have 4 wheel drive as weather is un predictable and goes bad generally in the afternoon. Start early in the morning so that the destination can be reached before dark. To visit Bumla pass, permit from Distric magistrate is required.
Visted in mid March 2011. Best season is April - November
Read full review 





Tawang
Post by Sumedha | Delhi | Mar 7, 2011
Drive from Guwahati/Tezpur. Break journey at Bomdila or Dirang. Roads are a bit dicey; so give enough time for landslides and other unforeseen circumstances. Throughout the way, you will get basic food like dal chawal and vegetables; and at certain places maggi and momos.
Give enough time to recuperate from the journey; even though we were a group of 20 year olds, we were a bit tired.
Read full review 





A beuatiful Cloudy Ride
Post by Dageesh
Reach Gauwahati by Train/Air, hire vehicles like Sumo to Pajoro based on your budget. Small cars should be strictly avoided
Book hotels well before your journey.
You can get help from friendly Military camps that'll be found across your ride to Tawang.
The road is porne to land slides.
Read full review 





Best of Best
Post by Chinmoy | Guwahati | Mar 26, 2013
Tawang could be reached both by air and road. But I would suggest road, as for me the travel itself is a cherished memory and in this way you could travel through some of the most amazing places and be a part of the history. But again the travel is not for some leisure loving and weak heart people. And be extra cautious while travelling in the months of Dec-March.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Anjaw



New Hawai
Post by Purna
The nearest city is Tinsukia. APST ply Tin-Hawai every alternative day. Or hire SUMO. It is at a distance of 350 km via Parashuram Kund (Holy Pilgrimage) or 250 km via Alubari Ghat (Lohit River).
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Bomdila



A ROAD TO THE HEAVEN.
Post by Bhavesh | Mumbai | Mar 19, 2013
Place enroute to Tawang, Hilly area so the tourist who have vomiting or nausea problems have to take care and carry proper medicines before starting the journey.
Read full review 





On the way to tawang
Post by Amitabha | Kolkata | Mar 13, 2013
From guwahati to valukpong, valukpong to bomdila Tejpur to valukponf road is more or less good,then the road is quite bad more or less 45 kilometer Avoid tejpur to valukpong after evening
n.b:- Inner line permit is necessary to visit Arunachal pradesh,you can do it from Guwahati, or one can do it from saltlake kolkata from arunachal bhaban
Read full review 







A pleasant surprise
Post by Debjit
Travel in Arunachal is very tough & you need to hire a car from any point & travel from either Itanagar or Guwahati. Roads are very bad & it's a no no entry during the monsoons.
Read full review 





Experience at Bomdila
Post by Manish
For going to Bomdila, one can come to Tezpur Airport by Flight & go there by Reserved or Shared Tata Sumo as said earlier. One should have patience during such long Journey.
One must have Inner Line Permit (ILP) for going there. Otherwise,you will be denied entry & get down at Assam Border. ILP can be received at Guwahati, New Delhi, Tezpur & Kolkata.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Tinsukia



Places of tourist interest in and around Tinsukia
Post by Jatin | Delhi | Jan 13, 2010
Best time to visit is October to March, local people are friendly and polite. Tinsukia is well connected to the rest of the country by air, rail and road.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Mangaldai



Nice place to visit 
Post by U | Bangalore | May 31, 2011
1. Reach fro any city of India by Flight to LGB International Airport or By train reach Guwahati train station.
2. Bus service available form Maskhowa or Adabari bus stop towards Mangaldai. (Better take ASTC bus) or rent a Taxi (Cost Rs. 1000 to max Rs.1300... do not pay Rs. 1500)
3. Guwahati to Mangaldai 70km only ( 1.5 hours journey )
4. Hotel Madhuban, Hotel Shyamalee is better choice to stay

Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Shillong



The Road through the Land of the Clouds
Post by Subhasree | Pune | Mar 1, 2007
Lots of companies run bus services through Meghalaya. However, book tickets a few days in advance if desirous of taking the AC luxury buses [recommended]. Due to sensitive situation in these places, it is strongly recommended that one avoids night bus journey. Please dress soberly and do not enter into debates on political or sectarian issues.
Read full review 





Shillong a Place In Cool Mist & Mellow 
Post by Subhankar
Guwahati is well connected with rest of India. From Guwahati, Shillong it is only three to four hours journey depending upon transport you choose. Apart from taxi, Govt. run tourist buses are available from Guwahati airport and railway station.
It is better to carry food pack & water in road transport. I always advise to book hotel before you reach there for tension free journey. Dependable websites, like presently you are going through, are there to help you.
Subhankar Mukherjee
Read full review 







In the Land of the Clouds 
Post by Dibyendu | Kolkata | Jun 1, 2011
The best time to relish Meghalaya is at the onset of the of the monsoon when the clouds descend to kiss the pristine hills & the sun plays hide-n-seek adding a surreal setting to the landscape. The best route by train is to avail the Saraighat from Howrah which reaches Guwahati around 9.30am. A journey of 3hrs by car takes one to Shillong. 
Read full review 





Shillong
Post by Vikas
Well there are no special tips. However since it is the land of clouds, you must be prepared lest a sudden downpour catches you unaware.
I landed at Guwahati airport and took a taxi to Shillong, however there is another airport around 25 kms from Shillong at a place called UMRI (I hope I remember the name right). Carry less luggage and enjoy your heart out!
Read full review 





Shillong-heaven in the clouds
Post by Abhi | Kolkata | Oct 14, 2008
Finally its nice to stay at Umium lake resort for one/two days, the beauty of the lake is far better than the much hyped Dal-lake in Srinagar. Prior booking is a must for that resort. Enjoy the unspoiled nature to the fullest extent in Shillong.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Cherrapunjee



Meghalaya - a place to behold....
Post by SHUBRO | Bangalore | Jul 5, 2010
Reached Guwahati from Kolkata by flight. Took taxi from airport to Shillong. Stayed in Shillong club, which was expensive but nice (right at the heart of the city). From there, we took the help of Pradip-da (9863087418), who was more than just a taxi-driver. He was our local guide, shopping guide, everything. We drove in his car to different parts of Meghalaya for 3.5 days but I wish I had few more days to enjoy more of the scenic beauty of Meghalaya. It was raining a lot and was cold also - so need to take appropriate gear for that.
Read full review 





Cherrapunjee - A Untouched beauty...
Post by Pamp | Chandigarh | May 27, 2010
To reach Cherrapunjee : From Guwahati you can hire a cab or take a state transport bus too... but I'll prefer to consult a trip planner agency to schedule your trip for you.
Read full review 







Rains in Cherrapunjee
Post by Shantanu | Guwahati | May 3, 2009
To travel to Cherrapunjee, reach Guwahati first by air or rail, take a taxi or a bus to Shillong, enjoy a couple of days there, and then take another taxi to Cherra. From Guwahati, the whole trip of 4 days will cost no more than 10 thousand (including fare). While returning, dont forget to drop in for a couple of days at Guwahati. It has the best sunset, over the Brahmaputra, the world has to offer!
Read full review 





Scotland of the East
Post by Siddharth | Chennai | Feb 22, 2012
Can reach by car from shillong. Approximately 90 kms from Shillong. Must not miss the ride from shillong to Cherranpunjee. The beautiful strips of gorges will keep you spellbound throughout the journey.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Tura



Heaven on the Earth!!!!
Post by NSingh
The nearest airport toTura is Guwahati & from there you can take Sumo Taxi Service or Catch a night bus.
Warning : Please dont try to go from Guwahati latenight by hired taxi as on the way some places are effected by the millitants.Its better to travel in daytime.
In tura dont argue with the people or auto drivers on the topic on politics otherwise you can put yourself in a big trouble.
Whenever you go for the rivers please do ask the local people if you are planing to swim in the river & without any guide dont try to enter the forest area of Tura.
Please dont miss-understand me but these are just some precatiouns so you can take care of yourself if you are travelling alone.
I know you all will love it when you will reach your this Holiday Destination & if till then i will open my mix branded shop there do visit it with your all family hehehheheh.So all my friends happy & save Jouney......
Read full review 





Tura one of the Heaven on the earth.
Post by NSingh
The best time to visit Tura is in Christmas & new year eve.The nearest airport to Tura is Guwhati airport 250 or 300kms from Tura from there you can go by taxi or buses.You can go from the helicopter service from Meghalaya Tourism but it runs only on some specified days in a week.
Warnings : Please dont take it lightly :
From Guwahati dont try to go alone & if you are going by private taxi better not to travel at night time cause many places on the way are effected by some bad groups.
When you go to any jungle or waterfall or riverside in Tura please dont try to play with the nature over there do ask local people there how safe it is cause many places there are effected by witchcraft practicing people.SO PLEASE DONT PLAY WITH NATURE THERE.
Dont try to get in any argument with the youngsters or auto drivers related to anything
specially politics & if you think you have a warm blood try to keep it calm there otherwise you will be a Deadman.
Dear Readers dont think i am threatening you but that's just for you so you can be aware.I have visited that places more than 10times & still do visit.I love that place like anything in this world.
Read full review 





Garo Hills: land of myths and legends
Post by Alva
How to get to Tura:- Air: The nearest international airport is the Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport at Borjhar, Guwahati. Fliers also have the option of disembarking at the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport at Kolkata then flying into Guwahati on any of Indian, Jet Airways, SpiceJet, Kingfisher Airlines, Deccan or Indigo flights. Direct flights to Guwahati are also available from New Delhi. The Pawan Hans helicopter service run by the state-owned Meghalaya Transport Corporation flies on Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays from Guwahati (Rs. 1,525) and Shillong (Rs. 1,200). Travel light. The maximum baggage allowed is 10 kg with no hand-baggage; also, children below the age of 10 are not permitted to fly.
Rail: The nearest railhead Guwahati is well connected from other parts of the country. Trains are available everyday to Guwahati from Kolkata's Howrah Station and take around 18 hours. Guwahati also has direct trains from New Delhi. India's fastest train, the Rajdhani Express takes about 36 hours. Trains from the South India include the Bangalore-Guwahati Express, Chennai-Guwahati Express and Guwahati-Trivandrum Express. A word of caution, do check ahead for strikes, road blockades or any agitation programme. The region is politically unstable and getting stranded en route a less desirable option.
Road: Buses ply from Kolkata to Guwahati via Siliguri with the option of breaking journey at Siliguri. Buses to Tura are available both from Siliguri and Guwahati, although the latter is the better and more convenient option. There are two slots for the bus service; the earliest is 0630 hrs and the latest 2030 hrs. This journey takes around seven hours and a seat for one costs Rs. 250. Buses leave from the newly built Inter-State Bus Terminal. Sumo (jeep) shared services are available twice a day (7 am and 2pm) from Baralumukh in Guwahati. A seat will cost Rs 300 per head and take 5 hours. For the heavier built, consider blocking (and paying for) two seats, drivers tend to pack the vehicle pretty tight.
Where to Stay:
1 - Rikman Continental, Tura Bazaar. Ph: +91 3651 220759/ 223858. Room rates range from Rs 850 to Rs 3000. Hotel and Bar attached.
2 ? Hotel Sundare (pronounce: soon ? daa ? ray), Tura Bazaar. Ph: N/A. Room rates range from Rs 750? Rs 3500.
3 ? Orchid Lodge, Araimile, New Tura. Ph: +91 3651 232039. Room rates range: N/A
4 ? Hotel Nataraj, Tura Bazaar, Tura. Ph: +91 3651 223189. Budget hotel.
5. Bed and Breakfast: Bliss Home Stay (B) Rates from Rs 2000/-. Ph:+919862475197 email:blisshomestay@gmail.com One can stay with a Garo family as a paying guest which will be arranged on request.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Aizawl



Aizawl unexpected
Post by Parminder 
Please note market open in the early morning closed early at 5P.M sunday total close best way to go there is by air main language is english and mizo some persons also speak Hindi.
Read full review 





MY AIZAWL VISIT
Post by Nripen
Direct flight from guwahati to aizawl available. Need to prepare 'inner line permit' which can be made in airport lounge. Airport to aizawl is 32 kms and local taxis are avalable. You can reach by road from silchar which is 8-9 hours journey from silchar. Bus and sumo service available from silchar.
Read full review 





uh.....
Post by Mike
Prepaid taxi must be arranged before coming outta airport.
transportation like bus, rickshaw is not available but taxi.
usually needed to pay 600-800 to reach Aizawl. previously it was 500RS, but taxi union made price almost fixed.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Champhai





Romance of Mountains and Sea of Mist
Post by Dolly | Gurgaon | Nov 28, 2011
The entire state runs on time-bound sumo service for which you have to buy tickets beforehand (they get sold very soon).
Ticket rates:
Aizawl to Champhai- Rs. 350 per person
Champhai to Zokhawtar- Rs. 50 per person.
If traveling in morning then opt for seat numbers 3 and 4
Between mornings and late noon go for seats 5 and 6
If traveling in evening then you can go for any seats from 1 to 6.
7,8,9,10 are the seats at the back and they are very bumpy and stuffy so avoid them if you can.
Seats 3 and 4 have the outlet for the passengers at the back seat so be prepared to get out when their stops come.
Also, be seated well in advance because they are very punctual (may delay only for 15-20 minutes) and also to avoid confrontation with people who might sit on your seat and refuse to understand your language and budge.
The only official stops between Aizawl and Champhai is at Saitual (80 kms from Aizawl) where you can attend to the natures call or have some tea and snacks.
People hardly know any lingo other than Mizo so be prepared with a few words for your own help.
The problem is not so much of language as of attitude because people are not very helpful and friendly. They will seldom smile at you though they will laugh at you lot.
Other General Tips:
Most autos have official rate charts so do see it as part of the fare negotiation.
Taxis are very costly in the entire state since its a mountain state.
People sleep early so order your food well in advance at the lodge. Also, plan your trip such that you reach the lodge by 6 or 7pm max. It gets very dark by then.
Shops close by 5 pm and even the eateries shut down by 7pm max.

Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Kohima



The Hill Queen
Post by Gopa | Kolkata | Apr 5, 2011
In many states of the North-East India you require Inner Line Permit. Specially foreigners need definitely. As our team consisted of all female members we had no problem although at borders of two states police check for permits. Tribals of Nagaland are to be handled carefully. In older times they were un-famous for human head hunting. You can reach Kohima by road from either Dimapur of Jorhat in Assam. Both Dimapur and Jorhat can be reached by air from Kolkata.
Read full review 





Kohima
Post by Anand | Bangalore | Oct 10, 2011
AIR : DIMAPUR is the only Airport in Nagaland at the moment. Direct flights connect the airport to Guwahati and Kolkota.
RAIL : Dimapur has a railway station on the main line of the North east Frontier Railway. It is well connected to Guwahati, with a number of trains that shuttle between the two stations every day.
ROAD : A number of taxis ply from Dimapur to Kohima. Prefer local shared taxi's over these buses. Night buses connect Dimapur and Kohima to Guwahati and Shillong (Meghalaya). A very convenient way for reaching Kohima is to take the train or flight to Dimapur and then rent a taxi to Kohima. The Dimapur taxi stand is adjacent to the Railway Station. Yellow taxis can be hired with other passengers (shared taxi) or exclusive (full taxi). One way fare from Dimapur Station to Kohima will be about 175/- per person for a shared cab.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

var date_of_journey=$("#date_of_journey").val();var requestData={from_destination_id:from_destination_id,to_destination_id:to_destination_id,date_of_journey:date_of_journey,date_format:date_format};HIQ.displayComponent('RedBusListing',$('#redbus_listing'),requestData);});});

Travelling Tips to Gangtok



SIKKIM - a must visit destination for nature lovers
Post by milsum | Pune | Feb 21, 2011
We reached Bagdogra airport at about 2.00 pm. A taxi booth is available at the airport for booking taxi (sumo/max and even Innova) to Gangtok. it takes about 4-5 hrs and cost ranges from Rs. 1600/- to Rs 2200/-. The taxis are not allowed directly to your hotel in Gangtok city if you reach there before 5.00 pm. They will drop you at taxi stand where you have to hire another taxi for local travel (Maruti van/Wagon r). Since we reached in evening the taxi driver dropped us at hotel (Mintokling guest house) by charging extra rs.200/-. 
Read full review 





Gateway to Sikkim
Post by Amit | Bangalore | Apr 27, 2006
The closest airport is in Bagdogra, West Bengal, about 5-6 hours drive from Gangtok. There are regular flights from Kolkotta, Delhi and other cities.
The closest train station is NJP (Siliguri) in north Bengal, also about 4-6 hours drive. Good roads connect Gangtok with Darjeeling, NJP, and Bagdogra.
Roads within Sikkim are really good. Avoid travel in the winter and monsoon. Landslides are common in the mountain roads.
Read full review 







Gangtok + Nathu La review
Post by Globetrotter | Kolkata | Oct 29, 2008
The major entry-point for Gangtok is Siliguri. Siliguri can be reached by the following means:
(A) By air - Bagdogra is the nearest airport. Bagdogra has daily connectivity with Kolkata, Guwahati and Delhi. Bagdogra is 14 kms from Siliguri. From Siliguri, you have innumerable options to reach Gangtok (bus and taxi). Take a pre-paid taxi from Bagdogra airport to SNT (Sikkim National Transport) bus-stand. It will cost you Rs 260. There is also a North Bengal Transport bus-stand which is in the same road.
From Bagdogra you can also have a helicopter ride to Gangtok; cost Rs 2000. Bagdogra airport has a counter from where bookings for the helicopter ride can be done. For more info, probably some other sources needs to be checked.
(B) By train - New Jalpaiguri (NJP) is the nearest rail-station. It is 12 kms from Siliguri. NJP has daily connectivity with trains from Kolkata, Delhi and Guwahati. From Mumbai, there is a train Dadar-Guwahati express which goes via NJP.
Once you reach Siliguri, ask for SNT bus-stand or NBSTC (North Bengal State Transport Corp) stand. Both the bus-depots are on the same main road about 1 to 2 km apart.
(1) SNT buses leave every hour for Gangtok. The last bus leaves at 13:30 hours. It is sometimes difficult to get a bus without waiting as there
is a queue. Ideally, you might get a ticket for a bus which departs after 1 hour.
(2) A better option would be to settle for a shared cab (Sumo, MaxX, Qualis, etc). They are usually 10-seaters (2 besides the driver, 4 in the middle and 4 at the back). We being a couple chose the front-seat from where you get a good view while
travelling. The only disadvantage of sitting at the front is for the person sitting next to the driver often being poked at due to the gear being adjusted. The cost is Rs 150 per person. Usually, if its the holiday season one needn't wait much for the taxis to get filled (we waited 15 minutes). During non-holiday season, the drivers usually depart before its even full
and you might get a bargain also in terms of price. We paid Rs 120 per person while returning.
A private taxi can also be booked for around Rs 1500.
There are lots of shared-taxis around the SNT bus-stand so locating one will not be a problem. The entire stretch has lot of private tourist buses also if one needs to inquire further.
The entire Siliguri-Gangtok route is 114 km and it will take anywhere from 3.5 to 4.5 hours to commute. Do not miss the following in your journey:
1. Mahananda Wildlife Sanctuary (15-20 km from Siliguri). Though we didn't sight anything out of the ordinary.
2. Teesta river which accompanies you for the major part of the journey offers some breath-taking views and photo-ops.
3. More than half-way into your journey, there is a stretch along the river where there are options for river-rafting both for swimmers and non-swimmers. The more adventurous can try it out. But its better to negotiate with the driver if you want to do so before you start your journey.
4. Soon on entering Sikkim, the Sikkim-Manipal Technology University on the banks of the river is a sight to behold.
While returning from Gangtok, you have the following options:
(1) Catch a helicopter ride to Bagdogra. The Sikkim Tourism office at the start of MG Marg provides you with booking options.
(2) Go to Deorali bus-stand and catch a bus or shared taxi to Siliguri.
There could be other options also but they need to be explored.
Precautions:
For the long hilly-rides, its better to carry medicines like Avomine (for Nausea and dizziness). Don't travel on an empty stomach and eat light before you travel, or else it will aggravate the problem. Maximum people were afflicted by nausea. I am no doctor, but I used a Avomine tablet as a precaution before my journey and it served its purpose. Carry an umbrella as the rains are unpredictable.
People with breathing problems and a weak heart might face an issue at Nathu La as the oxygen content is low and even healthy people had to struggle to walk-up a few steps. Such people should consult a doctor before travelling.
Read full review 







Enchanting Sikkim
Post by Gopa | Guwahati | Apr 5, 2011
Travel Tips: It is better to know about the place of visit before the journey.
How to reach: Gangtok is well connected by air from Bagdogra, by rail from NJP. Reserved as well as shared vehicles are available from NJP to Gangtok. Local vehicles (only 4 persons) are allowed for sightseeing at Gangtok.
Travel warnings etc.: No travel warnings. Only carry light woollen for summer and heavy woollen for winter, an umbrella must for monsoon.

Read full review

Travelling Tips to Pelling



Quet and outside the hustle of crowd :- nature loving and friendly Pelling
Post by Anupam | Delhi | Apr 25, 2006
The nearest airport is Bagdogra near siliguri
and the nearest rail head is New JalpaiGuri 6 kms from Siliguri .
From Siliguri you can hire a car or qualis or sumo and reach Pelling in 5 hrs. The road from Siliguri to Pelling is very steepy and narrow.Hence it is advisable to go by car/ qualis rather than by bus.
Also bus services is not so frequent... once a day
Read full review 





A lovely and a peaceful destination
Post by Abhi | Kolkata | Jul 16, 2012
Take a cab on hire to pelling if u r more than 7 and less than 10 , trip costs about Rs2500 to pelling from Njp.Or else u can take aauto rickshaw to SNT busstand and take the one and only bus to pelling Rs135 each , seats are good and comfortable journey too.
Read full review 







A calm serene place
Post by Suparna | Guwahati | Oct 12, 2011
You can reach Pelling both from Siliguri as well as Gangtok within 4-5 hours. Private cabs or shared ones (Mahindra Max). Approx. Rs 300/- from both places per seat. Reserved cabs will be around 3000 - 4000 rupees depending on availability. You should start early or else there may be less shared cabs. Take anti vomiting tablets half an hour before starting if you have problems in heights and twist and turns. 
Read full review 





Pelling, West Sikkim
Post by Anindya  | Kolkata | Jan 4, 2011
Shared/reserved jeeps from NJP station/Siliguri to pelling via jorethang. Alternatively, SNTS buses from Siliguri. Carry heavy woollen garments, flash lights (load shedding is a common problem in pelling) and last but not the least, a medicine kit.
Read full review 







Pelling - God's own land
Post by shenga | Kolkata | Sep 7, 2009
From New Jalpaiguri, take an Indica or Mahindra Max or Tata Sumo to Pelling, or you could go to SNT bus terminus and take a bus to Pelling. Or else you could go to Jorthang by jeep of same make from the jeep stand alongside the bus terminus, it is about about 2hr to 2hr.30 mins journey and then take another jeep to Pelling from Jorthang. The total journey will take you 4hr to 4hr.30 mins from New Jalpaiguri. Be careful about the fare from NJP, during off-season it is Rs.1500.00 and in season, it goes upto Rs.2200.00. If the trip is via Jorthang, then fare for each person is about Rs.180.00 to Rs.200.00 from SNT jeep stand to Pelling.
Read full review

Travelling Tips to Lachung



The place where sky meets earth.
Post by Praveen | Poso | May 31, 2012
The travel route is very narrow, stoney and full of twists and turns.. Small children and people with sensitive stomach should be careful..vomiting, nausea can happen. When you reach top even breathing may become difiicult for some people.
Read full review 





God's gift to us
Post by Nanda | Vijaywada | Jun 15, 2010
Do not travel during monsoon and when you get there contribute to the efforts of the local Govt. to keep the mountains clean and green by not using plastic and not littering around.
Read full review 





Wonderful trip to lachung
Post by Emani | Kolkata | Oct 3, 2012
Should be very carefull.. pls take tablets for vomiting, altitude sickness, headache and fever, as these will be prone. Also carry good amount of jackets especially if you are travelling in winter.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Namchi





Namchi Tour
Post by Parthab
If you are making journey by train, then you have to reach NJP (New Jalpaiguri). From NJP you have to go at Tenjing Norge busstand by bus, trecker. You can go by bus of Sikkim Tourism. The time of starting at 8.00 am & 12.00 pm. Or you can go by TATA Sumo, Jeep, or other for wheeler.
Hotels at Namchi are in reasonable fare.
Read full review 







A good rememberness, Namchi tour
Post by Parthab
You have to carry ID Proof, Address Proof with you. Carry some necessary medicine, woolen clothes & abviously CAMERA.... Other wise you will left all sweet moments which you have enjoyed there.
At first, you have to reach at Tenjing Norge Bus Stand at Siliguri. From there you can hire jeep, Tata Sumo, etc.. or you can reach Namchi by the bus of Sikkim Tourism Dept. It's situated near the Tenjing Norge Bus Stand.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Ravangla



a trip to remember
Post by robin
To reach this place you can hire share or reserve taxis from NJP station or Bagdogra Airport.Also you can get share taxis at cheaper rate from SNT depot.In general the reserved taxi will cost you anything between Rs.2300 to Rs.3000.In share basis it will cost you Rs.140 per head.Its a 4 hour journey from Siliguri via Sigtham or Namchi.
Read full review 





Visit to Ravangla
Post by Subhashis  | Kolkata | Dec 18, 2012
Ravangla is well connected to Siliguri (5 hrs aprox); break journey isalso possible at Jorethang or Singtam. Ravangla is also connected with other tourist spot of Sikkim, like Gantok (2hrs aprox) and Pelling (3hrs aprox).
Read full review 







Ravangla
Post by Poppy | Kolkata | Jul 7, 2009
You can reach Ravangla from NJP or from Gangtok. Fare one way from New Jalpaiguri should be around Rs.1600 for a hire/private car and almost Rs.1800 from Gangtok.
Read full review 





mt Narsing
Post by Himadri  | Ahmedabad | Dec 28, 2010
Roads can give you a headache better carry parasitamal. Climate can change without any warning therrfore, rain-wear and tough shoes are recommend. Aways carry woolens never know the weather will change from sunny to snow.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Yuksam



One Day in Yuksom is not Enough
Post by Zen | Mumbai | Jun 20, 2008
Yuksom can be reached by road either from Bagdogra or Gangtok. Be sure to leave either city early in the morning, for it is a long drive and the roads in the latter half of the drive are in a bad condition.
Read full review 





Yuksam- a silent paradise
Post by Indrajyoti | Kolkata | Jan 9, 2013
One can travel by train to New Jalpaigarsuri or travel by air to Bagdogra. The roads in the hills are mostly broken, so people with back problems should ideally travel in big cars with good shock absorbers or else may just land up with a Disc Prolapse.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Nathula



Mesmerising wonders of nature
Post by Lipsa  | Bhubaneshwar | Jun 28, 2012
To visit this place you need to have travel permits which one needs to get before oneday and start as early as possible and try to return before Noon as the weather sometimes becomes too rough and during heavy rain there can be land slide and being at such a high altitude, people may feel breathlessness . So acclimatised yourself with Gangtok first and then proceed to Nathula.
Read full review 





Nathula Pass - Heaven on Earth
Post by Mahesh | Bangalore | Aug 9, 2011
Hire a taxi from Gangtok which goes to Nathula.Bargain and see that the driver can take you till then original Baba mandir at around 15000 feet else catch your hotel guy and arrange for the trip.. Be sure to carry lot of photo copies of your ID card. The journey is very bumpy and climb to the temple might cause you some breathing problems because of altitude. Carry warm clothing as it extremely cold during winters.
Read full review 


Read more reviews

Travelling Tips to Agartala



Agartala / state of Tripura visit
Post by Amar nath | Delhi | Dec 11, 2012
Can travel through Air , Indigo, Jet & Air India flights are available. Train from silchar (MG) also connects to Agartala. Highway also connects Tripura to Guwahati ( Asam)
Read full review

$(document).ready(function(){$("#CheckBuses").click(function(){$('#redbus_listing').html('<img src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jqueryui/1.8.2/themes/ui-lightness/images/ui-anim_basic_16x16.gif" style="margin:25px 240px 25px 0px; ">');var to_destination_id=$(this).attr('data-to_destination_id');var from_destination_id=$(this).attr('data-from_destination_id');var date_format=$("#date_format").val()
var date_of_journey=$("#date_of_journey").val();var requestData={from_destination_id:from_destination_id,to_destination_id:to_destination_id,date_of_journey:date_of_journey,date_format:date_format};HIQ.displayComponent('RedBusListing',$('#redbus_listing'),requestData);});});
